Inés, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, pues considera que el servicio que ha recibido con el préstamo anterior ha sido aceptable, permitiéndole aumentar las ganancias en su negocio, con esta nueva deuda comprara productos para el negocio, arroz, aceite, jabón, detergentes, que son los necesarios para que su clientela este satisfecha.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, dándole el impulso para seguir trabajando con estos préstamos,  ya que sus ganancias fueron buenas le permitieron pagar el préstamo y aportar para sus obligaciones familiares, teniendo una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ines is asking for another loan, since he considers that his last loan provided him with a service which was reasonably helpful. It allowed him to increase the earnings of his shop. With this new loan he will buy products for the business; rice, oil, soap, detergents, which are necessary to keep his customers happy. 

The last loan had a positive impact on his business, and now he wants to continue working with these loans, since his earnings were good they allowed him to pay off the loan and contribute to his family’s expenses, improving his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, soap and detergents.

loans.name: Jose Misael

texts.es:
José, esta realizando la agricultura, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más dinero para comenzar el cultivo en una manzana de terreno,  el comprara abono, pagara el alquiler del terreno, con este aporte tendrá la seguridad del sitio donde se dispone a iniciar sus trabajos, esperando tener buenos resultados.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a mejorar el negocio en la venta frutas y verduras, el cual sigue manteniendo, en este periodo se ha beneficiado de sus ventas y a logrado cubrir sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
José is still working as a farmer. He is now seeking a new loan as he needs more money to begin cultivating his land. He plans to buy fertilizer and pay the rent for the land. With this support he will have a definite place to begin his work and hopes for a good harvest. 

José’s previous loan helped him improve his fruit and vegetable selling business. He is continuing with the business. Sales improved and he was able to pay for family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the rent for the land

loans.name: Adyajav

texts.en:
Adyajav is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. She lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Adyajav's two sons attend local secondary school and her husband delivers stationery to vendors who operate market stalls. For the past seven years, Adyajav has been operating a taxi business and she has gained much experience. She is planning to expand her business and says, "I have a dream to have my own grocery store one day to ensure my children’s future life."  

Adyajav has been building her grocery store in her backyard. She is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed to complete the building for her store. In the future, Adyajav thinks her grocery business will be very helpful to her and her family to improve their life in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials needed to complete building her grocery store

loans.name: Fatima Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Fatima bibi is 39 years old and married. She works doing sewing and embroidery to financially support her family. Her husband is also an embroidery expert who operates a business in the market. Fatima's husband is very skillful and his clients are very happy with his creative work. Fatima is also a very good housewife who performs her household duties very well. 

Fatima is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her brother’s business. Her brother works as a tailor and she will use her loan to buy him a new sewing machine and thread so that he can complete client orders on time and increase his income. Fatima is very hopeful about the future success of her brother who is a very experienced tailor.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and thread for her brother's tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap and beverages

loans.name: Bayanmongol

texts.en:
Bayanmongol, 31, is a craftsman who makes appliances, jewelry, and monuments out of gold or silver. He currently works as a craftsman in a private company and he has been doing his job for a decade. Bayanmongol's salary does not usually cover his family's necessities. He lives with his sister and her family in an old house in the ger district, an area with no running water, minimal roads, and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Bayanmongol decided to start a second business as a taxi driver to supplement his income and help his family. Last month, he bought an old car for his new business but he still needs to pay the full cost of this vehicle. Bayanmongol is requesting a loan to finish paying for his vehicle.

loans.use: to finish paying for his car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, bath soap, seasonings, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Ia

texts.en:
Ia is 22 years old. She lives in a small village in Baghdati District in West Georgia with her family: husband – Kakha, 2-year-old son, mother-in-law and sister-in-law.  Ia’s husband works as a worker in the village.  Ia is involved in the family's agricultural business. They have a greenhouse with the area of 180 sq. meters, as well as a 0.7-hectare plot of land. Both the greenhouse and land are used for tomato and greens growing.  Ia’s mother-in-law sells the harvested tomatoes and greens in the local open market. The total average monthly income for the family is 450 Laris.

Ia requested credit for the cultivation of the land.  She will pay for a tractor to till the land and purchase fertilizers. After properly doing the seasonal work, Ia and her family can count on a good harvest, which can be sold for convenient prices. The family will get more income than in previous years. Ia plans to use the increased income for the renovation of their house, as it is old and uncomfortable. After the renovation, the family will have better living conditions.

loans.use: purchase fertilizer and till her farmland

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Азимчон трудолюбивый человек, содержащий большую семью. Он живет вместе с женой У них семеро детей. Он занимается выращиванием сельхозпродуктов. В основном он выращивает лук, морковь и бахчевые культуры. В бизнесе помогают ему сын и дочка. Азимчон хочет увеличить урожайность земли и с этой целью он нуждается в покупке минеральных удобрений. С этой целью Азимчон запрашивает займ в размере 500 долларов США. Он надеется на вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Azimjon is a hardworking person, who supports a large family.  He lives together with his wife.  They have seven children.  Azimjon is involved in growing agricultural crops.  He primarily grows onions, carrots and melon crops.  His son and daughter help him with the business.  Azimjon wants to increase the harvest-ability of the land and needs to purchase mineral fertilizers to achieve this goal.  This is why Azimjon is requesting a loan in the amount of $500.  He relies on your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en:
Elshan is a 34 year old man who is married with two children. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds sheep and cattle and sells their meat to local butchers. Elshan’s father taught him how to look after cattle and he now has more than 10 years of experience in this field.

Elshan usually buys small cattle or lambs, raises and fattens them for five to six months and resells them for a profit in the local livestock bazaar.  By selling meat, he earns 120 AZN per month. People use beef and mutton in everyday national dishes and sheep fur is also very popular to make blankets.   

Elshan provides the only financial income for his family and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children.  He applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase one cow and six sheep.  This loan will be his second from Kiva partner AqroInvest.  Elshan  has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one cow and six sheep

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is a 32-year-old man who is married with one daughter.  He is an internally displaced person (IDP) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.   He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as the cattle meat to local butchers.  Ramil’s father taught him how to look after cattle and he now has more than 10 years of experience in this field. He receives 70 AZN monthly in financial support from the government, but this amount is too low to cover his family’s needs.

Ramil usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them for five to six months and resells them for a profit in the local livestock bazaar.  He sells milk and yoghurt to his neighbors.  Selling milk and meat provides Ramil with 100 AZN per month. Milk, yoghurt, and meat are very popular products in Azerbaijan as they are used in everyday national dishes. Milk products are also considered very healthy.   

Ramil earns the only income for his family and it is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children.  Ramil applied for a 1,000 AZN loan to purchase cattle and fodder.  Ramil has good client history and this will be the second loan from Kiva partner AqroInvest.

loans.use: to buy cattle and fodder

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 64 years old and lives with his nephew and daughter-in-law in a small village. They run an agricultural business. David has five milking cows and four calves. He produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. His nephew helps him with the sales. David also has several beehives with bee colonies. He makes ecologically clean honey and sells it in his village. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

David requested a loan for cultivation of land. He will rent a tractor and purchase fuel. After cultivation he will sow vegetables and fruits.During spring and summer he will work hard on the plot to get good harvest. After selling his harvest he will spend the biggest portion of his income to develop the agricultural business. He will be able to buy more calves and produce more cheese, to buy more bees and produce more honey. This will influence the income of the family and their living conditions will be improved.

David is hoping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to cultivate land for sowing more agricultural products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, bath soap, shampoo, seasonings and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sanoatchon

texts.ru: Саноатчон женщина в возрасте 39 лет,она замужем.Ее сын мастер ремонтных работ помещений.Она сотрудничает с нашей организацией с 2011 года. Саноатчон и ее муж около двух лет выращивают виноград и абрикос.Они имеют большой виноградник и много плодовых деревьев.Для того чтобы получить хороший уражай необходимо обеспечить огород миниральными удобрениями поэтому на полученный кредит Саноатчон хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения.Фрукты они поставляют на местные и центральные рынки.Так как они развозят фрукты не маршрутном такси и им это обходится очень дорого на полученную прибыль они решили купить сбственный автомобиль.
texts.en: Sanoatchon is requesting her next loan to purchase mineral fertilizers for her vineyard and apricots.  She has been partnering with our organization since 2011.  Sanoatchon is 39 years old.  Her son is a repairman and makes repairs to buildings.  Sanoatchon and her husband have been growing grapes and apricots in their orchard for about two years.  They supply the fruits to the local and central markets.  They plan to use the resulting profit and savings to purchase a car.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos y vive con ellos en el municipio de Puerto Cortes.
Doña Lourdes  posee desde hace 6 años un negocio de venta de ropa nueva, venta de calzado y variedad de accesorios de belleza la cual vende de manera ambulante  en las colonias vecinas de su comunidad. Dice que este negocio le ha sido muy rentable generándole beneficiosas ganancias de las cuales ha podido reinvertir  en el negocio y también con los financiamientos que Odef le ha proporcionado a logrado surtir el negocio y mantenerlo estable.
Doña Lourdes es una señora bastante trabajadora, lleva 7 prestamos como Odef,  actualmente solicita el octavo de 12,000 lempiras para invertir en comprar mas mercadería para el negocio como ropa, zapatos, y otra mercadería con la que no cuenta.  Se siente motivada a seguir beneficiándose de los prestamos que odef le ha proporcionado ya que su negocio a prosperado mucho desde que inicio y su calidad de vida es mejor que antes.
texts.en:
Lourdes, age 51, is a single mother, and she has three children.  She lives with them in the Puerto Cortes municipality.

Lourdes has had a business of selling new clothes, shoes, and beauty accessories for six years.  She sells in an itinerant manner in the neighboring communities.  She says that this business has been very profitable.  It has generated profits that she has been able to reinvest in her business.  Also, with the loans that ODEF has given her, she has managed to stock her business and keep it stable.

Lourdes is a very hard-working woman.  She has had seven loans with ODEF.  She is currently requesting her eighth loan for 12,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her business.  She will buy things like clothes, shoes, and other merchandise that she does not have.

She is motivated to continue benefiting from the loans that ODEF has given her.  This is because her business has prospered a lot since she started it, and her quality of life is better than before.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like clothes, shoes, and other merchandise that she does not have.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old, married, and has two children who are in college. She supports her family through her business. Her husband owns a studio. 

She runs a second-hand clothing business. She has been in this business for two years. Her monthly income is 9,000 KES. She plans to use the loan to add to her stock of sweaters, shirts, and women's tops. 

This is her first loan with KADET, and she plans to use her anticipated profits from her expanded business to identify a shop in the market and sell from there.

loans.use: To add to her stock of sweaters, shirts, and women's tops

loans.name: Rosely Sarahi

texts.es:
Rosely tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera y vive en la ciudad de Yoro junto a  su hijo y su madre y hermanos.
Rosely no dejo de estudiar y de capacitarse, desde joven aprendió repostería que tanto le gusta, hace aproximadamente 12 años que con mucho esfuerzo y voluntad estableció su propio negocio, ella elabora y vende pasteles para toda ocasión. Poco a poco lo ha mejorado mediante préstamos y tiene buena demanda. Actualmente está solicitando el cuarto préstamo a ODEF, con el cual se va abastecer de materiales para la elaboración de pasteles, tales como harina, azúcar, margarina, huevos etc. Esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar la producción y a cubrir la demanda.
La idea es que su negocio sea exitoso para expandirse y llegar a tener varios negocios en diferentes puntos, y poderles dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y a su hijo.
texts.en:
Rosely is a 28 year old single mother.  She lives in the city of Yoro with her son, her mother, and her siblings.

Rosely did not stop studying or learning.  When she was young she learned pastry making, which she likes so much.  Approximately 12 years ago, with great effort and willpower, she established her own business.  She makes and sells cakes for all occasions.  Little by little she has improved the business through the loans, and there is  a good demand for her cakes.

She is currently requesting her fourth loan with ODEF.  She will use the loan to stock the ingredients to make the cakes.  She will buy things like flour, sugar, margarine, and eggs, etc.  This investment will help her increase production and cover the demand.

The plan is for her business to be successful in order to expand, and she will come to have various businesses at different places.  The plan also includes being able to give her family and her son a better quality of life

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, eggs, margarine, and other ingredients to make cakes.

loans.name: Christian Enrique

texts.es:
Christian es un joven de 22 años de edad, padre de un pequeño d e6 meses de edad y junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro cada día para poder darle una vida de calidad y llena de amor y cariño para su pequeño, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de chincha, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, también se le conoce por ser la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano y también porque sus pobladores tiene una buenísima sazón para la preparación de platillos, sobre todo de la comida típica. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta salir a pasear con su esposa y su pequeño, sobre todo para compartir un tiempo con su familia, en ocasiones le pide a su esposa que le prepare uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo Picante de Res. 

Con el día a día Christian trabaja como empleado en un hospital de su ciudad en el servicio de lavandería, es un trabajo muy duro, sobre todo porque siempre está en contacto con la humedad;  el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable, honrado y sobre todo respetuoso.

Christian está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva sobre todo porque gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mejoramiento en la pequeña vivienda donde él vive ya que realizara unas mejoras en las paredes como tarrajeo, pintado, mejoramiento de tuberías, entre otros, de esta manera podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y así el podrá seguir luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Tener su casa propia ya que donde él vive es alquilada”.
texts.en:
Christian is a young man, 22 years of age, and the father of a 6-month-old son. He and his wife work very hard every day to be able to provide a quality life, full of love and caring, for their little one. Their home is located in the city of Chincha, known for its warm and pleasing climate. It is also known as the cradle of major glories in Peruvian sports and, in addition, because its residents have very good taste in the preparation of dishes, especially their local plates. When Christian has a little free time, he likes to go for a walk with his wife and young son, and particularly to spend time with his family. On occasions, he asks his wife to prepare one of his favorite dishes, the delicious Picante de Res (Spicy Beef). 

Christian works daily as an employee at a city hospital in the laundry department. It is very hard work, especially because he is always in contact with humidity. Christian works around 10 hours a day. He thinks he is doing well in his work because he is very responsible, honorable, and above all, respectful.

Christian is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, especially because thanks to their help, he has been able to make some improvements to the little house where he lives and, in particular, to the walls, including plastering, painting, and improving the plumbing, among other things. In this way, he will be able to offer a better quality of life for his family and, thus, continue struggling daily to realize his grandest dream: to have his own house, since where he lives now is rented.

loans.use: to make improvements on the home he rents.

loans.name: Asilbek

texts.ru: Асилбек мужчина в возрасте 26 лет.Он живет в Дж. Расуловском районе.Он женат и имеет троих детей.Около 8 лет  занимается откармливанием крупно рогатого и мелкого рогатого скота.Он живет по близости рынка скотов,там он приобретает и продоет свой скот.Покупая по дешевле скот, откармливает и там же продает по дароже. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве  в Дж. Расуловском р-не но и дома она старается помогать мужу.Асилбек на полученный кредит хочет приобрести мелкого рогатого скота,расширить свой бизнес,увеличить семейный доход и дать своим детям достойное образование.
texts.en:
Asilbek is a 26 years old man. He lives in the J. Rasulov region. He is married and has three children. He has been engaged in fattening cattle, sheep and goats for around 8 years. He lives near the market where he buys and sells his livestock. He buys livestock for a low price, fattens them and then resells them for a higher price. His wife works at a dekhan farm in the J. Rasulov region but she also tries to help her husband. 

Asilbek wants to buy sheep and goats for the received loan, to expand his business, increase the family's income and give his children a decent education.

loans.use: to buy livestock for fattening and reselling

loans.name: Delmida

texts.en: Delmida of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, has been providing transportation for more than five years and earns 3,000 PHP per month. She’s 53 years old now and yet continues to hang on with her transport business to give an adequate life for her child. She became a member of GDMPC in 2010. In order to enhance her business, she is borrowing 5,000 PHP from GDMPC to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. Delmida hopes that someday her child will be successful in her career.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in her business

loans.name: Javzanpagma

texts.en:
Javzanpagma, a 35-year-old hardworking woman, lives with her family in a ger (a traditional Mongolian felt tent) in a ger district which lacks basic infrastructure in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband is a driver for a local gas company, having previously worked for a public transportation company for 9 years.

Javzanpagma started her business in the ending of 2004 and the beginning of 2005 by selling building materials at Tsaiz, the largest outdoor wood market in Mongolia, with a working capital of 2,000,000 MNT. She buys raw materials from a wood truck which comes from the countryside, and as a result of her hard work, she now has working capital of 8,500,000 MNT. 

Javzanpagma is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy more wood for the upcoming season. Her business is very popular during the summertime, so she wants to purchase more wood as a reserve. Javzanpagma wants her children to get an excellent education and her goal for the upcoming year is to build a new small house for her family. A repeat and trusted client, she is very thankful to all Kiva lenders for giving her an opportunity to improve her business. In addition, Kiva Fellow Jonathan has visited her house and really enjoyed it.

loans.use: to purchase wood for the upcoming season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her stock of canned goods, snacks, soap, and beverages

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married mother of two children, who are attending school. She is married to a driver, and they live in a rental house that has electricity, but no piped water. Hellen operates a salon, which she has been running for the last five years. She aspires to open a boutique in the future. Other sources of income include earnings from her spouse, who is a driver. Her potential customers are mostly women and school girls. She describes seasonality to be her major challenge and food to be her greatest monthly expense.

The loan of KES 10,000 will enable her to purchase cosmetics.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es:
Carolina de 32 años de edad, es casada tiene 2 hijos, vive en Cofradia, Cortes, con su familia.
Ella tiene 3 años de dedicarse a la venta de mercadería como zapatos, sandalias, perfumería y achinería.Con este negocio aporta al hogar. Sus  ventas las realiza a domicilio mediante pedidos y vende en su casa también. Ella  solicita a ODEF 3,000.00 Lempiras porque quiere surtir de más mercadería nueva para ofrecer a sus clientes y aumentar las ventas. Siendo su meta hacer crecer el negocio para obtener ingresos que le ayuden a cubrir gastos del hogar. Agradece el apoyo mediante este préstamo.
texts.en:
Carolina, age 32, is married and has two children.  She lives in Cofradia, Cortes, with her family.

For three years she has been selling merchandise like shoes, sandals, perfume, and knickknacks.  She supports the household with this business.  She makes her sales by taking orders door-to-door.  She also sells at her house.

She is requesting a loan for 3,000 lempiras from ODEF.  She wants to stock more new merchandise to offer her customers and to increase sales.  Her goal is to make her business grow in order to get income that will help her cover the household expenses.  She is grateful for the support of this loan.

loans.use: to stock her business with new merchandise.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 34-year-old married man, father of two children. He has been selling coffee, juices, and hookah for the last five years.
Mahmoud is a hardworking man and an entrepreneur. He made his business out of nothing; he turned his useless van to a steady fixed coffee shop. He placed a water barrel on top of his van. From it, he takes water through a water hose attached to a tap to the stainless steel sink (shown on the right side of the picture). 
Mahmoud is proud of what he has and is planning to expand his business more and more.
He has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to make a new tent that will cover him from summer heat and from the coming winter's rain, because the old one is not good anymore. Mahmoud will also paint the new place he renting for his shop to keep his customers satisfied.
Mahmoud hopes to expand his business more in the future and open his own official coffee shop, although he feels that the van is his lucky charm.
He also works as a drummer at night to cover his family's expenses. This is his fifth year working in the coffee business, and he hopes to expand more in the future.

loans.use: to make a new tent, necessary for his business, and paint the place he's renting for his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new power saw for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of bath soap, shampoo, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is thirty-nine years old and married to Patricia with four children. He runs a hardware shop and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000.

He has been in the business for five years and this is his first loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use the money for increasing stock such as spare parts, gardening tools, gloves, etc.

He plans to use the anticipated profit to educate his children and ensure he can meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as spare parts, gardening tools, gloves, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and office and school supplies.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is thirty years old and married to Mary, with two children. He has a dairy and pig rearing farming business, with a monthly income of twenty thousand shillings only.  

He has been in the business for nine years. This being his fifth loan with KADET LTD, and having successfully repaid the previous loans, he intends to use the money for purchasing a dairy cow. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to expand his farming business and give his children a good education.

loans.use: To purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is an embroidery expert. She has got great skills and prepares beautiful embroidered clothes for her clients. Her rates are also very reasonable which helps her get more orders every month. 
She has given birth to 4 daughters and a son. Her three younger children are studying while her elder son works. Her eldest daughter is 20 years old and helps Manzooran in her routine tasks. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her brother-in-law, who is involved in the animal sales business. With the loan, he will buy animals like goats and sheep. He will fatten them up by giving them good quality food. This will help him to sell them for higher profits. 
He has been operating his business for many years and Manzooran is hopeful that the loan investment will help him in improving his business.

loans.use: to buy goats and sheep for selling.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is thirty-nine years old and married to Elizabeth with two children. He runs a business that deals in hawking sugarcane, with a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

He has been in the business for four years. This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He plans to use the loan to open a store for sugarcane and also buy more stock of sugarcane for sale. He intends to be prosperous in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugarcane for sale and open a facility for storing sugarcane.

loans.name: Ley's Group

texts.en:
Ley is 40 years old. She is a married mother living in a rural village of the Mongkol Borey district, Cambodia. She has four children, three of whom are still in school and dependent on her. To make a living, she has been farming rice and also planting maize and cucumber as her family’s source of income. She has been doing this for ten years. The main challenge for her is the lack of working capital and seeds for her farm due to flooding in the past years. 
Ley's group consists of four female members who live in the same village. She has been with VisionFund for three cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund for one to four cycles. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her support her business and gradually make a better living. She earns about KHR 23,000 per day from her current business to spend for daily expenses. She is leading this group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and spend a portion of it on plowing. She hopes this loan will help her to raise more good quality crops to sell so she can keep her children in school. She also hopes to fulfill her dream of having a new, larger house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is taking out another loan to expand her existing business. She will use her loan to purchase bundles of shoes to sell. Since her loan, Fatuma's monthly income has increased by over fifty percent. Her business is running very well and she plans to open a wholesale location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed mother of two adult children. She lives in a rented house without electricity or running water. For the past three years, Fatuma has operated a business selling fish at the market center. Her primary customers are local residents. Fatuma joined Yehu to get access to loans.

Fatuma is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell, firewood, and cooking oil. She dreams of having electricity in her house and of purchasing a refrigerator in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish, firewood, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is 33 years old and lives at the Albreij refugee camp in Gaza. For the past five years, he has owned a clothing shop. 

Ramzi is requesting a loan to buy new goods. He approached Ryada to develop his business and increase his income. Ramzi's ambition is to expand his shop, increase his income, and improve his lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy clothing and goods for his shop

loans.name: Nimol's Group

texts.en:
Nimol is 37 years old, a married mother of three children, two of whom are still dependent on the family. Her family lives in a rural area of the Mongkol Borey district. She earns a living through rice farming on one hectare of farmland and raises pigs to support her family. She has been involved in her business for ten years. The main challenge for her is the low crop yield from the rice farming business. She earns around KHR 24,400 per day to support her daily expenses.
Nimol’s group consists of four members who all are female. She has been with Kiva’s field partner, VisionFund, for three cycles while the other members have been with VisionFund for two to three cycles. She is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Nimol, who is the group leader, is going to use her portion to purchase fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to buy one piglet and pay for plowing. She hopes this loan will help her grow more rice and feed her pigs to be fat and healthy so she can set aside some money to extend her farmland and purchase a hand tractor for rice farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkol Borey District

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa is a single parent with 2 children. Adjoa is a petty trader. She operates a grocery shop at Abeashia near Elmina. She has done this for 2 years. The items in her grocery shop are tin fish, tin tomatoes, milo, different kinds of drinks, biscuits, toffees, milk, soap, etc. Adjoa uses her income to pay  her children’s school fees. She will use her loan to purchase a variety of groceries to sell. With the new profit, Adjoa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase a variety of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina  is a food vendor. She cooks rice and fish stew for sale at Abreshia near Elmina. Paulina is divorced and has 2 children. She has been in this business for 3 years now. She uses her income for the general upkeep of her children. Paulina will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and sell. With the new profit, Paulina plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook and sell.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 56 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos y vive en el Municipio de Puerto Cortes.
Martina tiene un negocio de un taller de venta de repuestos, aceites, lubricantes, baterías para vehículos y motocicletas. Este servicio lo inicio hace 30 años y manifiesta que le ha ido bastante bien ya que cuenta con sus propios clientes. Dice que los ingresos que este negocio le genera  son a diario, porque son productos de mayor demanda para el mantenimiento de los vehículos,  y espera continuar obteniendo mejores ventas para que sus ganancias sean mejores.
Esta solicitando el tercer préstamo con ODEF de 21,000 lempiras para invertir en compra de mejores repuestos, aceites, lubricantes, baterías y otros accesorios para la venta. con esta inversión espera que la rentabilidad del negocio sea mejor, ofreciendo a sus clientes calidad de productos para los vehículos.
Su meta es seguir trabajando para alcanzar la estabilidad económica para ayudar a sus hijos a seguir con los estudios.
texts.en:
Martina, 56, is a single mother; she has three children and lives in the municipality of Puerto Cortes.  Martina has a business that’s a shop selling spare parts, oil, lubricants and batteries for vehicles and motorcycles.  She started the business 30 years ago and states that she’s done quite well and that she has her own customers.  She says that income from the business is generated daily because her products are in high demand for vehicle maintenance and she hopes to continue getting better sales so that profits will be better.

She’s asking ODEF for her third loan in the amount of 21,000 lempiras to buy better spare parts, oil, lubricants, batteries and other accessories to sell.  With this investment she hopes that the business’ profitability will be better offering her customers quality products for the vehicles.  Her goal is to continue working to attain economic stability to help her children continue with their studies.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, lubricants, batteries and other car repair accessories.

loans.name: Silvia Carmelina

texts.es:
Silvia, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo  ya que ha instalado un negocio de comida, a parte de la tienda de productos domésticos, y necesita comprarse productos que sean igualmente utilizados dentro de la tienda y que sirvan para elaborar comida como el Aceite, arroz, frijoles, pollo, condimentos, y otros productos.
El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ayudándole a incrementar el negocio y con las ganancias logro ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Silvia is asking for a new loan because she has set up a food business, apart from her general store, and needs to buy products that are both used in the store and with which she can use to make meals, such as oil, rice, beans, chicken, seasonings and other items. The previous loan had a positive effect, helping her to expand the business and with the profits she was able to successfully help her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, beans, chicken, seasonings and other products

loans.name: Khoja

texts.ru: Хоча продолжает свою деятельность. Он вместе с сыном занимается торговлей в магазине. Сейчас у него магазин со смешанным ассортиментом товаров. Он берет кредит для покупки продуктов и приобретения хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en: Khoja continues his business activities. Together with his son, he runs a shop that presently sells assorted merchandise. He is taking this loan to stock up on food products and household goods.

loans.use: to buy food products and household goods

loans.name: Sotikhon

texts.ru: Сотихон жительница района Бохтар. Ей 52 года. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Она занимается животноводством более девяти лет. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Sotikhon resides in the Bohtar region. She is 52 years old, married, and has six children. Sotikhon has been raising livestock for over nine years. She is taking this loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 25 years old. He is married to Teresia and they have one child. For the past three years, Francis has been a carpenter who earns a monthly income of 11,970 KES. His wife runs a saloon for additional income. 

Francis is requesting his first loan with KADET LTD to purchase more carpentry materials. He plans to use the profits from his loan to expand his business and open more outlets.

loans.use: to purchase stock for his carpentry business

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en:
Yucabeth  is 43 years old and is married with three children. She is a businesswoman who distributes Farmers health care products and has run her business for ten years. Yucabeth earns 60,000 KES monthly.

Yucabeth is requesting a loan to purchase more stock of Farmers health care products. This will be her second loan from KADET LTD, and she plans use her anticipated profits to expand her business and become a prosperous businesswoman.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of Farmers health care products

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is a petty trader. He trades in ladies' and children's dresses, underwear, jeans, and shoes, which he has done for 4 years. Daniel is single. He uses his income to pay for his accommodations and utility bills. He will use his loan to purchase more ladies' and children's dresses, jeans, and shoes to sell. With the new profit from his expanded business, Daniel wishes to acquire a shop to sell his goods.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies; and children's dresses, jeans, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en: Sabina is a seamstress; she makes dresses for sale at Abershia, near Elmina. She has been a seamstress for 5 years now. Sabina uses her income to pay for her accommodations and utility bills. Sabina will use her loan to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make dresses for sale.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is taking out another loan of KES 20,000 to start a charcoal and firewood-selling business. In addition, she is operating a juice-selling business and she intends to use part of this loan to repair her refrigerator for preserving her juice. Since her previous loan, her life has been running smoothly and she plans to open other small businesses in the near future.

loans.use: to repair her refrigerator for preserving her juice.

loans.name: Flor Alejandrina

texts.es:
Flor, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para incrementar su negocio, pues su objetivo es hacer inversiones periódicas que le permitan mantener surtido el negocio, comprándose granos básicos frijol, arroz, aceite, papel higiénico, pastas, productos de aseo personal, entre otros que son de mucha importancia.
Ella tiene experiencia con créditos, permitiéndole manejar varios con la institución, es un cliente con buena moral de pago y con muchas ganas de superación, ella considera que los préstamos anteriores le han permitido incrementar el negocio, ayudar a su familia y permanecer prosperando.
texts.en:
Flor is asking for a new loan to increase business because her objective is to make periodic investments that will allow her to keep her business well-stocked buying basic grains, beans, rice, oil, toilet paper, pasta, personal hygiene products, among others that are very important.

She has experience with loans; she’s had several with the institution.  She’s a client with good payment behavior and with a strong drive for self-improvement.  She feels that previous loans have allowed her to increase business, to help her family and to continue making progress.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, shoes and underwear.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es:
Jenny tiene 31 años, es una señora muy amable, trabajadora y valiente. Es soltera, pero tiene tres hijos de 17, 15 y 13 años, a quienes tiene que criar sola porque su ex pareja la dejó con esa responsabilidad. Pero para ella sus hijos son su razón de esfuerzo y sacrificio, no tiene ningún problema de afrontar esta difícil situación sola. Vive con sus hijos en la casa de su padre.

Su trabajo es la venta de comida. Acondiciona un espacio en la vereda de su casa para la venta de desayunos (unos deliciosos jugos de frutas y sándwiches) por la mañana, y por las noches ofrece comida regional. Lleva trabajando así cerca de 10 años y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos. Inicio sólo con  los desayunos, y con el tiempo fue implementando día a día más variedad de platos. Le agrada mucho lo que hace, le encanta cocinar y siempre está en la expectativa de brindar lo mejor a sus clientes. Además de esto, en algunas ocasiones trabaja en un restaurante donde brinda sus servicios de cocinera y por ello recibe un pago adicional que significa un ingreso más a su economía. Tiene como plan a futuro tener un local para su restaurante y un puesto de lavado de autos.

Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 2500 soles, comprará algunos equipos y materiales para implementar el lavadero de motos en su casa, ya que es un proyecto que estaba queriendo realizar hace mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Jenny, 31, is a very kind, hardworking, brave woman.  She’s single but has three children who are 17, 15 and 13 years old that she has to raise by herself because her ex-partner left her with that responsibility.  For her, her children are the reason for all her efforts and sacrifice.  She has no problem with facing this difficult situation alone.  She lives with her children in her father’s house.

Her work is selling food.  She sets up a space on the street where she lives to sell breakfasts (delicious fruit juices and sandwiches) in the morning and at night she offers regional food.  She’s been working for about 10 years and her children help her occasionally.  She started out just with breakfasts and in time day to day added more variety of dishes.  She likes what she does very much; she loves to cook and is always ready to offer the best to her customers.  In addition to this, she occasionally works as a cook in a restaurant and receives an additional salary which means another income for her economy.  Her plan for the future is to have a space for her restaurant and car wash stand.

This is her 4th MFP loan so she hopes to continue toward her objectives.  On the other hand, she commits once more to make her installment payments like she’s done with previous loans she’s had.  She likes being part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible, mutually supportive people.

She will use the requested 2500 soles to buy some equipment and supplies to set up a car wash service at home since it’s a project she’s wanted to do for a long time.

loans.use: to buy car washing equipment.

loans.name: Claudia Del Rosario

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia de condición muy humilde, trabajadora con buenas con mucha ganas de superación personal que tiene una herramienta de trabajo que es la venta de refrescos. Comenzó hace 4 años con su negocio para mejorar la economía de su familia. Poco a poco fue incrementando su actividad. En la actualidad tiene una gran variedad de clientes que disfruta de sus deliciosos refrescos. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere seguir trabajando, y gracias al apoyo que  fundación león 2000 le ha brindado por lo que con el préstamo desea comprar: frutas, bolsas, pajillas, Azúcar,  entre otros.
texts.en: Claudia is of modest means.  She is hardworking, and has a strong desire to better herself.  She will do this through her business selling beverages.  She started this business 4 years ago to improve her family's finances, and then gradually expanded the business.  Now she has a large number of customers who enjoy her delicious beverages.  She has a lot of aspirations for her business, and for this reason she wants to continue working.  Thanks to the support provided to her by the Fundacion Leon 2000, she will use this loan to buy fruit, bags, straws, sugar and other supplies.

loans.use: to buy fruit, bags, straws, sugar and other supplies

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is 50 years old. He's a married man with 5 children, two of whom are in school.
He has been working in the agricultural field planting his land for 16 years. Ali asked Ryada for fund in order to develop his agricultural projects and plant more cucumbers and thus increase his income and improve the life of his children and family. His ambition is to build a better life and improve the quality of his life.

loans.use: to develop his agricultural projects and plant more cucumbers.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 29-year-old married man with two children who are six and four years old. One of the children goes to school.

Martin has been in the business of selling used clothes since 2006 and works six days a week by moving from market to market on different designated days. He supplements his income by growing beans, maize and coffee, which he sells if they are in surplus. Martin has no specific clients but sells to people from all walks of the countryside within Rakai.

His major challenge comes during the rainy season when they barely work since they have to protect the goods from getting wet and sometimes the goods fall off the trucks during transportation. 

Martin's dream is to start a wholesale shop so that he can stop hawking but also sell to retailers.

He describes himself as honest and resilient. UGAFODE loans have enabled him to expand his business and meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 49 años, es un buen hombre, muy trabajador. Es soltero y no tiene hijos, tiene una casa propia donde vive solo, ya que su familia vive en otra ciudad.
Su trabajo es el transporte de pasajeros en su motocarro. Se levanta muy temprano para salir por las diversas calles de la ciudad en busca de sus eventuales pasajeros, quienes esperan en busca que les movilicen de un lugar a otro. Lleva 9 años en este trabajo y con lo que hace puede brindar algunas comodidades a su familia. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disponer de su tiempo, ya que las horas de mayor demanda son en el horario de entrada a los colegios y centro de labores de las personas, las demás horas se dedica a esperar en la puerta del hospital a los usuarios para movilizarlos. Le está yendo bien debido a que su mocarro es propio y no tiene que pagar alguien. Tiene como planes a futuro poder comprar otras dos motos para ampliar su flota y alquilarlas.

Este es su préstamo 13 con MFP, está muy contento de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en los anteriores créditos que tuvo. Le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará algunas piezas y enviará a su motocarro al taller para que le hagan algunas reparaciones, ya que se deterioró con el paso del tiempo y el mal estado de las vías.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 49, is a good, very hardworking man.  He’s single and has no children.  He owns a house where he lives alone since his family lives in another city.

His work is transporting passengers in his vehicle.  He rises very early to go out into the various streets of the city looking for occasional passengers who are waiting looking for someone to move them from one place to another.  He’s been in this business 9 years and with everything he does is able to provide a few comforts for his family.  What he likes about his work is that he can manage his time since the hours of most demand is when the school day and the work day start.  Other times he waits at the entrance to the hospital for users needing transportation.  He’s doing well because he owns his vehicle and does not have to pay anyone.  His future plan is to buy two more vehicles to expand his fleet and lease them out.

This is his MFP loan #13.  He’s very happy to know that he’ll have financial support because he’ll feel surer that way of advancing with his business.  
On the other hand, he commits once more to make his installment payments like he’s done with previous loans he’s had.  He likes being part of his communal bank because all its members are very responsible, mutually supportive people.

He will use the requested 1000 soles to buy some parts and will send his vehicle to the shop for some repairs since it’s worn down due to the passage of time and the poor state of the roads.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Wellen

texts.en:
Wellen is a married man aged 40 years old with four children. Two of his children attend school. Wellen is an agriculturalist who specializes in milling millet and cassava. He works 7 days of the week and earns an average income of 300,000/- per month. He supplements his farming income with income from a saloon and from charging phones using solar energy since his village does not have power. He charges only 500 UGX (five hundred Ugandan shillings) for each phone that is charged and charges at least six phones each day.

Wellen is not borrowing for the first time, his previous loan was 2,000,000 UGX, which he used to buy a milling machine. This time he has applied for UGX 3,000,000(Three Million uganda shillings) so that she can buy a motorcycle, which will be used as a 'boda boda' for transport business. The motorcycle will supplement his family income and he will be able to meet his other daily obligations.

His major challenge has been lack of enough capital to buy fuel for the milling machines since petrol and diesel are very expensive in Uganda, making it very hard for him to meet his customers' needs.

He is grateful to UGAFODE beause the loans have helped him to attain assets like the milling machine and the motorcycle he intends to buy  He describes himself as very hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Gorden

texts.en:
Gorden is 31 years old and married with five children between 3 and 11 years old. Four of his children attend school and he looks after his nephew whose parents are not able to take care of him.

Gorden does agriculture and trades coffee. He works six days a week and makes a net profit on average of UGX 400,000 per rmonth from coffee sales. He supplements this with the sale of milk and plantain (matooke). He started 10 years ago and has been able to acquire assets like motorcycles,land and meet his day-to-day family obligations.

Gorden wants 3,000,000 UGX to complete payment on a piece of land, for which he has already deposited 5,000,000 UGX. The major challenge in his business is price fluctuations, where he buys the coffee and the price falls before he sells it, which affects his profit margin.

Gorden is very hard working and shrewd.

loans.use: to complete payment for a piece of land

loans.name: Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Fatima is the mother of two sons and a daughter. She is a great mother and wife who takes care of her family very well. She is also a working lady and operates a sewing business from her home. She is very good at her work and receives regular orders every month.  Her husband is also a sewing expert and attached to a tailoring business. 

Fatima has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy a new sewing machine because his current machine has become old and he is unable to meet deadlines. By purchasing a new sewing machine, he will be able to complete the client orders on time and increase his sales and profits. He has been operating his business for many years and Fatima is confident about his business success.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for tailoring business

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is 54 years old. She's married and has a family of three, and one child at school.

Samira has owned a grocery store since 2006. Samira sked Ryada for funds to buy groceries, ice cream, and cleaning supplies for the store and improve the decoration of the store.

She believes that the loan will help her to develop her store and improve their income.

loans.use: to buy groceries, ice cream, and cleaning supplies for the store and improve the decoration of the store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting trees, and other machines and instruments for the shop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has four children, all attending school. She operates an academy, their potential customers being the primary school children in the area. She says that a majority of the parents are reluctant to pay school fees, posing a challenge for her. Alice owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her aim is to expand her academy to accommodate more school children. Her choice to join Yehu was to access loans.

The loan of 40,000 KES will enable her to purchase desks and stationery.

loans.use: to purchase desks and stationery.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es: Heladia tiene 44 años de edad y es originaria una localidad mazahua llamada Francisco Serrato, una comunidad donde la gente es muy trabajadora y hay una vista espectacular a sus montes tupidos de arboles de pino y donde la gente de su localidad extrae la materia prima para hacer artesanía de ocoshal. Doña Heladia tiene un molino desde hace cuatro años y dice que lo puso por falta de uno en su comunidad ya que antes tenían que moler los granos para hacer tortillas en un metate y gracias al molino ya las mujeres de su localidad no se cansan tanto ya que en el molino es más rápido moler sus granos, también dice que muele granos para hacer mole (comida regional) ya que son varios granos los que se muelen para hacer esa comida. Dice que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de refacciones para su molino y también para la compra de cal, maíz, leña ya que también vende masa para hacer tortillas. Comenta que ella surte sus productos que ocupa para hacer la masa en una población llamada Zitacuaro donde le dan precios mas económicos. La meta de doña Heladia es comprar otro molino de mayor capacidad para mejorar también las condiciones del pueblo y más adelante quiere vender tortillas hechas a mano. Los otros cuatro integrantes del grupo se llaman Virginia, Ramon, Maria Jacinta y Maria Concepcion ellos invertirán sus créditos en la compra de artículos para surtir una tienda de abarrotes, en frutas y legumbres de temporada para su venta, en la compra de dos vacas para criarlas y después venderlas y en la compra de refrescos para su venta.
texts.en:
Heladia is 44 years old and is originally from a Mazahua town called Francisco Serrato, a community where the people are hardworking and there is a spectacular view of the mountains, dense with pine trees and where the local people extract the raw material in order to make crafts from ocoshal trees.

Heladia has had a mill for four years and she says that she got it because the community did not have one. Before they had to grind the grain on a metate [handmade grinding stone] for making tortillas and thanks to the mill the women in her town never get tired and the mill grinds the grains much more rapidly. Also she says that they grind grains to make mole (a regional food) and that there are various grains that they grind to make that meal.

She says she is asking for a loan in order to buy some spare parts for her mill and also to buy some lime, corn, firewood and she also sells mesa [dough made from a mixture of flours] in order to make tortillas. She comments that the products she uses to make the masa come from a town called Zitacuaro where she obtains a better price.

Heladia’s goal is to buy another mill of larger capacity in order to improve the conditions for the people of the village and later she wants to sell tortillas made by hand.

The other four members of the group are called Virginia, Ramon, Maria Jacinta and Maria Concepcion. They will use their loans to buy articles to supply a grocery store, for seasonal fruits and vegetables to sell, to buy two cows to raise and later sell, and to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to have a mill serviced

loans.name: Carmen Yaneth

texts.es:
Carmen de 36 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene dos hijos con quienes vive en la ciudad de Puerto Cortes.
Hace más de dos años que ella decidió establecer un negocio que le genere los ingresos necesarios para su familia, es un pequeño negocio donde elabora y vende jugos naturales, agua en bolsa helada, churros y dulces. Este negocio de venta lo tiene enfrente de una terminal de buses donde hay afluencia de personas que viajan de un lugar a otro, lo que le permite incrementar las ventas. Esta solicitando un tercer préstamo para comprar productos como frutas, agua, churros y dulces, con esta inversión va ofrecer más producto a los clientes y piensa incrementar los ingresos. Su meta es hacer un bonito troco de hierro más amplio y presentable para atraer más los clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen, 36, is a single mother; she has two children she lives with in the city of Puerto Cortes.

Over two years ago she decided to start a business that would generate income needed for her family.  It’s a small business where she makes and sells natural juices, cold water in bags, snacks and candy.  She has this sales business in front of a bus terminal where there are many passersby who are traveling from one place to another which allows her to increase sales. 

She’s asking for a third loan to buy products like fruit, water, snacks and candy.  With this investment she will offer more products to customers and she intends to increase income.  Her goal is to make a pretty, more spacious and presentable iron stand to be more attractive to customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit, snacks and candy.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is taking out another loan of Ksh 10,000 to expand her existing business. She will be able to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. Her dream is to open a boutique in future. She thanks Kiva and Yehu for their financial support. Her living standards have also improved.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 32 years old, married and a mother of one child. She operates an M-pesa business (mobile phone money transfer) in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last two years. She earns a monthly profit of 15,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers, and she is applying for her first loan of 30,000 KES. She intends to use the loan to add business float needed for her business. 


She will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her child. In future, Esther hopes to grow her M-PESA business and also intends to open up a full boutique in the area.

loans.use: To add business float for her M-PESA business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is 36 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Rachael has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells cosmetics. 

To help expand her business, Rachael has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics like body lotions for resale and will help Rachael to generate greater profits and increase her profits from her business. Rachael hopes that in the future she will be able to become more rich. 

Rachael is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rachael who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics such as body lotions for resale

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is taking out another loan of Ksh 40,000 to expand her existing business. Since the previous loan, her income has increased. She has managed to open a new fish-selling business selling them at the market. With the loan, she will be able to purchase sacks of charcoal and fish for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and more fish to stock for sale.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en:
Kamel is a 30-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only one child. He’s the main source of income for his family. He has been working as an electrician for the past ten years. His work consists of setting and installing home electricity. He works upon request on a free-lance basis. 

Today, he is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renew his business equipment. This will definitely boost his work thus his profits. In the future, he plans to open his own electrical products shop.

loans.use: to renew his business equipment

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is 34 years old and supports a family of five people. She is married to John and they are blessed with three children aged between 14 and 17 years. Fatuma has been in the green grocery business for six years; she deals with both wholesale and retail selling, earning Ksh.50,000 monthly.

 She is currently servicing her 4th loan of KES.100,000 with KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. 

She is going to use the loan to purchase beans, onions and potatoes for resale. She intends to plough back the anticipated profits into her grocery business. Her hopes and dreams are to prosper both in business and in her daily life.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, onions and dried beans for resale.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en: Zahra is a 60-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband. They cooperate together to be able to fulfill their needs and demands.  She opened her own grocery store in 2002. She’s well known for being very friendly and welcoming. Today she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop in order to increase her sales thus her revenues. In the future, she plans to open her own mini-market and hire someone to work with her.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her shop

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is 34 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past six years, Henry has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Henry to generate greater profits and expand his business by adding more clothes to his inventory. Henry hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business further. 

Henry is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Henry who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Ammar

texts.en:
Ammar is 50-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He’s the only source of income in the family and taking on his  own, all expenses and responsibilities. His wife is also showing a good support.  From part of his income, he’s paying his children’s educational fees and from the other part he’s seeking to offer his family a decent way of living.  

Ammar has owned a poultry shop for the past twenty-six years and he’s well known for his generosity and cleanliness. Today, he’s looking to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to expand his shop and buy the needed quantity of chicken. He notes that this will return to him with high profits. In the future, he seeks to open his own fast-food restaurant.

loans.use: to expand his shop and buy the needed quantity of chicken

loans.name: Karen

texts.es:
Karen tiene 23 años, es una joven mujer amable, entusiasta y con muchas ganas de superación. Es soltera, no tiene hijos y actualmente se encuentra estudiando. Vive en casa de su madre y juntas trabajan mucho para poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo es la venta de productos de belleza, directamente y por catálogo. En su casa armó un pequeño salón donde exhibe todos sus productos, además de ofrecerlos a sus amigos, vecinos y familiares. Ella tiene un buen trato y siempre hace sentir importante a sus clientes. Lleva realizando esta actividad por 5 años y trabaja a lado de su madre con quien forman un equipo muy bueno.
Hace algunos años atrás, se vio en la necesidad de buscar algún ingreso para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar, y así a pocos fue vendiendo y haciéndose de muchos productos en stock. Ahora le está yendo muy bien y tiene muchos clientes que la esperan para hacer sus compras y pedidos de cosméticos y perfumería.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta por el respaldo financiero porque así podrá aumentar su capital de trabajo. Sabe que tendrá que ser muy responsable y sobre todo, muy puntual. Está contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que ve que son muy solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1600 soles, comprará los productos de belleza que están en oferta, para venderlos a su precio normal. También arreglará algunas partes de su casa, ya que necesita dar mayor comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Karen, 23, is a kind, enthusiastic young woman who very much wants to improve.  She’s single and has no children; she’s currently studying.  She lives in her mother’s house and they work hard together to be able to have a better quality of life.

Her work is selling beauty products directly and via catalogue.  She set up a small salon at home where she displays her products in addition to offering them to her friends, neighbors and family members.  She has a good way of treating people and always makes her customers feel important.  She’s been in this activity for five years and works alongside her mother; they make a very good team.

A few years ago she needed to find a source of income to meet her household expenses and this is how she started selling a few and gradually stocking more products.  Now, she’s doing very well and she has many customers who wait for her to make their purchases and place orders for cosmetics and perfumery.

This is her fifth MFP loan; she’s very happy for the financial backing because she’ll be able to increase her working capital.  She knows that she must be very responsible and above all very punctual.  She’s happy to belong to her communal bank because they are all very mutually supportive.

She will use the requested 1600 soles to buy beauty products that are on sale to resell them at normal price.  She will also do some home improvements because she needs to provide more comfort for her customers.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Laider

texts.es:
Laider tiene 47 años, es un buen hombre, muy trabajador. Junto a su pareja tiene tres hijos menores, quienes dependen de ellos para su cuidado y estudios. La casa donde viven es propia y está ubicada en el kilómetro 26 de su localidad.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y bebidas. Tiene una tienda de abarrotes en su casa y además siembra frutas cítricas en la chacra que heredaron de los padres de su pareja. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 16 años, trabaja solo y algunas veces contrata la ayuda de algunos peones. Se inició con siembras pequeñas, cosechaba lo mínimo, pero de a pocos fue haciendo crecer su negocio y ahora vende en grandes cantidades. Le está yendo muy bien, está vendiendo en sus cítricos en la ciudad, y en la venta de abarrotes avanza cada día más. 
Ahora, con estos dos ingresos no tiene los problemas anteriores para mantener a su familia. Tiene muchos planes a futuro, pero para realizarlos debe juntar aun mucho capital, espera poder consolidarse con lo que hace y tener más ventas.

Este es su crédito número 19 con MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos. Está muy comprometido en pagar, una vez más, las cuotas a tiempo y de manera responsable. Se siente muy cómodo en su banco comunal, ya que sus compañeros de grupo son muy responsables y siempre se solidarizan con los demás.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 soles, comprará bebidas y abarrotes para su tienda; y contratará a algunas personas para hacer la limpieza y cosecha en su chacra.
texts.en:
Laider, 47, is a good, very hardworking man.  He and his wife have three minor children who depend on them for their care and their schooling.  The house they live in his and it’s located on kilometer 26 of his location.

He sells groceries and beverages.  He has a grocery store at home and he also grows citrus fruit in a parcel of land passed down by his wife’s parents.  He’s been doing this work for 16 years.  He works alone and sometimes hires some day laborers.  He started out with small crops and harvested the minimum but he gradually made his business grow and now he sells large quantities.  He’s doing very well; he’s selling his citrus fruit in the city and grocery sales advance more every day.

Now, with these two incomes he no longer has the problems he used to have to support his family.  He has many plans for the future but to make them a reality he must still gather much capital.  He hopes to consolidate himself with what he does and to have more sales.

This is his MFP loan #19 so he hopes to continue toward his objectives.  He’s very committed to pay, once again, his installment payments on time and in a responsible way.  He feels very comfortable in his communal bank because his fellow group members are very responsible and always supportive of each other.

He will use the 1000 soles requested to buy beverages and groceries for his store and he will hire some people to clear his fields and bring in the harvest.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es:
Lilia tiene 23 años, es una mujer amable y muy emprendedora. Junto a su pareja tiene dos hijos de 5 y 2 años, ellos son su motivo de trabajo, esfuerzo y sacrificio, pues desea brindarles siempre lo mejor y mejorar su calidad de vida. Esta familia vive en la casa de los padres de Lilia.
Los fines de semana, en las ganaderías del distrito, busca los mejores animales, al mejor precio, luego vende la carne al por mayor. Se inició con la venta de animales más pequeños, pero con el tiempo fue creciendo y ahora se dedica exclusivamente al ganado vacuno. Lleva trabajando así por 3 años y lo hace a lado de su pareja, quien siempre la apoya en todo. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, pues tiene tiempo disponible y siempre hay ganado con qué trabajar, además ella se encarga de administrar mientras su pareja conviviente es el que hace el trabajo duro y eso le permite estar mas descansada y ver mas hace el trabajo pesado. Ganan un promedio de 30% su inversión y desde que empezó a trabajar con este negocio ya no tiene problemas económicos. Pero como mujer emprendedora desea hacer crecer su negocio, además de tener invertir en otro diferente, que aun no decide cuál.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un préstamo para cumplir con sus objetivos. Por su parte se compromete a ser puntual en sus cuotas y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece, ya que todos son muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 soles, comprará dos animales para seguir haciendo su trabajo.
texts.en:
Lilia, 23, is a kind, very enterprising woman.  She and her spouse have two children who are 5 and 2 years old.  They are what motivate her towards work, effort and sacrifice since she wants to always give them the best and to improve their quality of life.  This family lives in Lilia’s parents’ house.

She goes out to local cattle ranches on weekends looking for the best animals at the best price and then she sells the meat at wholesale.  She started out selling smaller animals but in time she grew and now she deals exclusively in cattle.  She’s been working like this for three years and she does it alongside her spouse who always supports her in everything.  She likes what she does very much because she has time available and there are always cattle with which to work.  Besides, she runs the business while her spouse does the hard work which allows her to be rested.  They earn on average 30% over their investment and since she started with this business she’s had no economic problems.  However, as an enterprising woman she wants to make her business grow and also to invest in another, different one although she hasn’t yet decided which.

This is her MFP loan #6.  She’s very happy to know that she’ll have a loan to reach her objectives.  On her part, she commits to be punctual with her installment payments because she does not want to disappoint the group she belongs to since they are all very responsible.

She will use the 1500 soles requested to buy two animals to continue doing her work.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell their meat.

loans.name: Jamil

texts.en:
Jamil is a 62-year-old Lebanese married man who is living with his wife. He is the one responsible for his family and is looking to enhance their way of life. He has owned a pickup for the past thirty years. His job consists of transporting products and home furniture upon request. He works independently, on a freelance basis. 

Today, Jamil is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his pickup. This will certainly facilitate his business operations and help develop his career. In the future, he plans to hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his pickup truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add to her stock of sugar, flour, bread, and cooking oil

loans.name: Hanaa

texts.en: Hanaa is a 46-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and two children, who are still studying. They are a united family, cooperating together in order to enrich their way of living. Her husband started his business as a sweet maker in 1996. As for Hanaa, she has been selling accessories and perfumes from her home for the past ten years. Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more products such as accessories and perfumes for her business in order to boost her sales and earn a superior income. In the future, she plans to open her own perfumes and accessories shop.

loans.use: To purchase more products such as accessories and perfumes for her business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 38 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the Arua region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Jessica has been working hard to manage her drug shop, which sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine to sell, and it will help Jessica to generate greater profits and expand her business by adding more medicine. Jessica hopes that in the future she will be able to get more experience by going back for studies. 

Jessica is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Jessica, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but they have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more medicine to sell

loans.name: Verano Group

texts.es:
Rosa Ines una señora joven de 32 años; está casada con el señor David quien es policía auxiliar del estado, y tienen 3 hijos el mayor se llama Andrés tiene 13 años y cursa el 2° de secundaria, Laura tiene 6 años y cursa actualmente 1° de la primaria y el más pequeño tiene apenas 1 añito.

Rosa es comerciante, tiene un pequeño negocio en su casa donde vende dulces y productos de abarrotes como aceites, jabón, pastas, chiles y frijoles enlatados entre otras cosas y ella con su gran esfuerzo, dedicación y responsabilidad con el próximo préstamo quiere hacer más grande su negocio; es una meta que se ha propuesto para los siguientes meses y ella cree que lo logrará.
