Rosa es uno de los integrantes del grupo Verano, tal grupo esta integrado por 6 personas responsables que a continuación serán mencionados junto con cada una de las actividades que desempeñan: Isabel vende refrescos, Luis Daniel es mecánico, Antonia vende comida, Delfina vende calzado por catálogo, Rosa Ines vende productos de abarrotes y Alexis trabaja en maquinarias.
texts.en:
Rosa Ines is 32 years old and is married to David, who is a state police officer.  They have 3 children: Andrés, the oldest, is 13 years old and is in his second year of secondary school; Laura is 6 and is in her first year of primary school; and the youngest is barely a year old.

Rosa works as a merchant.  She has a small business in her house where she sells sweets as well as groceries such as cooking oil, soap, pasta, chili peppers, and canned beans.  Rosa has put considerable effort, dedication, and responsibility into her work, and she wants to use her next loan to make her business bigger.  That is her goal for the next few months and she thinks she will be successful.

Rosa is one of the members of the Verano [‘Summer’] group, which is made up of 6 responsible individuals.  These are the members, along with their respective activities: Isabel sells soft drinks; Luis Daniel is a mechanic; Antonia sells food; Delfina sells shoes from a catalog; Rosa Ines sells groceries; and Alexis works on machinery.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as cooking oil, soap, sugar, and pasta.

location.town: Cruz Grande, Municipio Florencio Villareal, Estado

loans.name: Las Flores Del Campo Group

texts.es: Doña Marcelina tiene 51 años de edad, ella es originaria de una localidad donde la principal atracción es la mariposa monarca la cual es un patrimonio universal y su conservación, responsabilidad de los mexicanos. Ella se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la elaboración de bordados artesanales; dice que cuando es temporada de vacaciones sube al santuario a vender sus servilletas, blusas, manteles, almohadones que ella misma borda y elabora, dice que sus materiales los compra en diferentes tiendas de una población llamada Zitacuaro donde le dan precios bajos y así pueda quedarle un poco mas de ganancia, dice que emprendió ese negocio para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos, ya que son 5 y aún viven con ella. Ella está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de material para hacer sus bordados como agujas, estambre, cuadrille (tela), hilos, ganchos etc. Dice que si le dan el  crédito ella puede hacer crecer su negocio y dice que está  muy contenta de poder recibir este recurso que le servirá para seguir adelante con su negocio. La meta de doña Marcelina es poner un negocio estable en su localidad. Además, le gustaría tener una tienda de abarrotes para ya no salir de su casa y estar más al pendiente de sus niños. Las otras cuatro integrantes se llaman Irma, Martha, Maria Remedios y Maria de Lourdes; ellas pidieron sus créditos para invertirlos en la renta de juegos de video para dar servicio de estos, en artículos de tienda de abarrotes y en dulces de diferentes sabores para venderlos.
texts.en:
Marcelina, age 51, is from a place where the main attraction is the Monarch butterfly.  The Monarch butterfly is a universal heritage, and its conservation is the responsibility of all Mexicans.

She has been embroidering products by hand for over 20 years.  She says that when it is vacation time she climbs to the sanctuary to sell the napkins, blouses, tablecloths, and pillows that she embroiders herself.  She says that she buys the materials in different stores in the city of Zitacuaro.  They give her low prices there, and that way she is able to make a little more.  She says that she started this business in order to help her husband with the children’s expenses.  They are five, and they still live with her.

She is requesting a loan to buy materials to do her embroidery.  She will buy things like needles, fabric, thread, and hooks, etc.  She says that if she gets the loan she will be able to make her business grow.  She says that she is very happy to be able to receive this resource that will serve her to get ahead in her business.

Marcelina’s goal is to establish a stable business in her area.  Also, she would like to have a grocery store so that she would not have to leave her house.  That way she would be more vigilant with her children.

The other members are Irma, Martha, Maria Remedios, and Maria de Lourdes.  They are requesting their loans to invest in renting video games in order to provide this service, buying grocery store products, and buying different flavors of sweets to sell.

loans.use: to buy needles, fabric, thread, and hooks, etc. for her embroidery.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 25-year-old Lebanese woman who lives with her husband and five children, all of whom attend school. Unlike other women in her place, she cooperates with her husband to offer their children a fair way of living. She strives to work really hard and don’t hesitate to offer help whenever the family needs it.

Very welcoming and friendly, Zeinabe has enjoyed success as the owner of a minimarket in her town since 2005. Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy supplementary products for her minimarket to be able to grow her business. In the future, she plans to enlarge her enterprise and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products for her minimarket

loans.name: Angel Gabriel Group

texts.es:
El comité “Angel Gabriel” se encuentra en el quinto ciclo del programa de Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya, sus integrantes son mujeres jefas de familia que se esfuerzan diariamente por dar a sus hijos el pan de cada día y de esa forma darles una vida digna.
Limpia es la presidenta del grupo, y comenta que se dedica a la venta de prendas, como ser remeras, polleras, pantalones y demás, es gracias a su trabajo y a su esfuerzo que ha podido salir adelante como microempresaria y a la vez ayudar a su familia. Limpia es una mujer con  muchos deseos de superación, lo cual transmite a sus amigas con su apoyo y su incentivo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frío y quiere tener un buen stock de prendas que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Angel Gabriel group is in the fifth cycle of the Women Entrepreneurs of the Fundación Paraguaya. Its members are heads of family who struggle every day to give their children their daily bread and a life of dignity.

Limpia is the president of the group. She comments that she works selling clothing, such as shirts, skirts, pants and others. It is thanks to her work and her efforts that she could get ahead as a micro-entrepreneur while at the same time helping her family. Limpia is a women who wants to succeed, who inspires her friends by her support and encouragement.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy winter clothes, as the cold season is approaching and she wants to have a good stock of clothing to offer to her customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka is taking out another loan of KES 25,000 to expand her coconut selling business. Since the last loan, both her sales and entire monthly income have increased. Her aim is to open a shop in the future. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for the loan given, which has really improved her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of coconuts to sell

loans.name: Ana Deisy

texts.es: Ana Deisy  de treinta y nueve años,  habita junto a su hija de quince años y un hijo de cinco años en casa de su propiedad al oriente del país en zona rural.  Tiene 5 años de haber comenzado con una tortillería en su hogar de habitación dado que ella es la única que trabaja para sacar adelante a sus hijos.  El padre de sus hijos ayuda con la crianza de los hijos,  pero no es suficiente ya que sus hijos se encuentran estudiando y cada día las exigencias son mayores. Esto hace que día con día se levante muy temprano para preparar los materiales que le permitirán elaborar las ricas tortillas. Cabe mencionar que tiene mucha clientela ya que con el tiempo ha logrado ganarse la confianza de sus vecinos los cuales cada día la prefieren más. Habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su familia, pero esto no le quita las ganas de salir adelante y continuar luchando.  Cada año invierte en leña y maíz al por mayor para tener como reserva,  ya que cuando el invierno llega es difícil de conseguir estos productos  ya que  los precios se ven  aumentados.  En esta ocasión no puede hacer la inversión por su cuenta y es por esta razón que solicita a INTEGRAL este credito para poder realizar dicha inversión. Teniendo en cuenta que este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y que de esta forma lleva el sustento a su familia, confía que podrá realizar la compra de estos productos ya que son necesarios para el movimiento de su tortillería.
texts.en:
Ana Deisy, age 39, lives with her 15-year-old daughter and her 5-year-old son in her own house, which is located in a rural area in the western part of the country. She has been operating a tortilla shop out of her home for five years and it is the only work that she does to help her children get ahead. The father of her children does not help with raising them. Her income is not sufficient since her children are studying and the daily demands get greater. This motivates her to wake up early to begin preparing the ingredients she uses for making her delicious tortillas. It should be mentioned that she has many customers because she has gained the trust of her neighbors over time and their preference for her product grows more each day.

Ana and her family live under very modest conditions, but this does not dampen her drive to succeed and continue fighting. Each day she invests in firewood and corn in bulk so that she will have supplies on reserve. When winter arrives, it is difficult to secure these products since the prices are higher. On this occasion, Ana is not able to make this investment on her own, so she is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral for this very reason. Given that this business is her main source of income by which she is able to sustain her family, Ana is confident that she will be able to buy these products since they are necessary for keeping her tortilla shop in operation.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn in bulk.

loans.name: Jovenes Unidos Group

texts.es:
El comité jóvenes unidos es de la ciudad de Ybycui, está integrado por 16 jóvenes visionarios, con ganas de salir adelante y de ser alguien en la vida, que puedan ayudar a sus familias y darles lo que necesitan.
Aliexis es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante, se dedica a la venta de prendas, con lo cual puede ayudar en los gastos de la casa y de esa forma hacer un poco las ligero los gastos. Es una persona con ganas de crecer y ser alguien en la vida.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar más prendas, y asi ofrecer variedad a sus clientes. El sueño de Aliexis es poder ser un gran microempresario y asi poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Jóvenes Unidos" communal bank in the city of Ybycui is made up of 16 visionary young people. They are eager to succeed and be someone in life, and to be able to help their families and give them what they need.

Aliexis is a very hard-working person and eager to succeed. He sells articles of clothing, through which he is able to help with the household expenses and that way make them a bit lighter. 

He is a person with a strong desire to grow and be someone in life. He is applying for the loan to be able to buy more clothing, and so offer variety to his customers.

Aliexis' dream is to be a great small business owner and this way be able to continue helping his family.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El Comité Nueva Esperanza, pertenece al primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya,  ellas son 13 señoras muy trabajadoras y con ansias de crecer y salir adelante, ven en el trabajo la única forma de salir adelante y ayudar a sus hijos.
Aurora es la presidenta del grupo, y comenta que siempre ayuda a sus compañeras en lo que puede, las trata de animar y juntas siempre trabajan para poder mejorar sus vidas. Aurora se dedica a la venta de leche, y cuenta que tiene muchos clientes en la zona, a los cuales lleva su producto desde muy tempranas horas y regresa ya muy en la siesta. Ella es una persona muy sacrificada y por sobre todo emprendedora.
Solicita el crédito para poder comprar leche, ya que no quiere quedarse sin stock de su principal producto, pues sabe que le hará falta.
texts.en: The group Nueva Esperanza ('new hope') is in its first cycle with field partner Fundación Paraguaya's program for women entrepreneurs. It is composed of 13 very hardworking women who want to grow and stay afloat: they see work as the only way to prosper and help their children. Aurora is the group's president and she says that she always helps her comrades as much as she can: she tries to encourage them and together they work to improve their lives. Aurora sells milk and tells us that she has lots of customers in the area, to whom she delivers milk starting at a very early hour in the morning and coming home only much later, in the afternoon. She is a very dedicated person and most of all she is very invested in her business. She asks for this loan to buy milk, since she does not want her main product to run out of stock, for she knows she will need it.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat, 56 years old, is married to Anasyanjia and they have three children. He runs a transportation business, earning a monthly income of only 9,655 KES.

Josphat has been in this business for two years and this is his first loan from KADET LTD. He intends to use the loan to buy spare parts, wheels and fuel for the business. He also plans to use the anticipated profits to increase his transport machines.

loans.use: To buy spare parts, wheels and fuel for the business

loans.name: Rukia

texts.en:
Rukia is the mother of two children, both enrolled in school. She is married to a teacher and they live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

For the last 5 years, Rukia has been selling khangas (a traditional type of women's dress in central/east Africa) in a shop to the general public. She chose to join Yehu because it has a clear regulatory framework. Rukia aims to expand her business and reach more customers. Her major business challenge is credit defaulters. Rukia plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase bundles of khangas to sell.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of khangas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 46-year-old married man. He lives with his wife and three children, two of whom are studying while the third works. Like all parents, Fadel dreams of a shiny, better future for his children, and he’s ready to offer them whatever they need to study well and to graduate.

Fadel has been working as a taxi driver since 2000. He now needs to take out a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform needed maintenance on his car. He notes that this will allow him to transport his customers safely without facing problems. In the future, Fadel plans to buy a bus in order to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his car

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 24-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one working sibling. His father covers the family expenses. In order to be able to cover his educational fees until graduation, Ahmad works really hard and nonstop at a fruit and vegetable shop.  He really wants to study and achieve higher positions, which is why he’s now asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to cover the rest of his university fees. In the future, Ahmad plans to take out more Kiva loans and pursue his Master’s degree.

loans.use: to cover the rest of his university fees

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mbale, in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Irene has been working hard to manage her production business, which sells dry food such as maize and beans. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more maize for resale, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Irene hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a milling machine. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more maize for resale,

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline, 28 years old, is single and supports a family of four. She is blessed with two children, aged 4 and 9. For the past 5 years, Caroline has operated a business selling fruit, earning KES 30,000 monthly. 

Caroline is servicing her third loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying her previous loans. She plans to use this loan to purchase mangoes, watermelons, oranges, bananas, and pineapples for resale. Caroline plans to use the anticipated profits from her business to purchase more fruits for resale. Her hope and dream is that her business prospers so as to earn maximum profits from it.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, watermelons, oranges, bananas and pineapples for resale.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents. He has two working siblings. Ali has been working as a salesman at a local clothing shop while hoping to carry on his education in order to reach higher positions. For that reason, he has big and serious responsibilities. Ali now wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay his own educational fees until graduation. He will be more than happy to graduate and achieve his Master’s degree.  In the future, Ali plans to take new Kiva loans and maybe open his own business.

loans.use: to pay his own educational fees until graduation

loans.name: Maranatha Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria Felix es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable ella cuenta con 40 años de edad  está casada con el señor Víctor, él trabaja en la empresa Coca-Cola, tienen 4 hijos que actualmente todos están estudiando uno de ellos que es el mayor tiene 17 años y cursa el 2° de la preparatoria, Víctor tiene 15 años y cursa el 2° de la secundaria, Alejandra tiene 9 años y cursa 3° de la primaria, y el mas pequeño tiene 8 años y el cursa 2° de la primaria todos aquí en la localidad de Florencio Villarreal.
 
Maria Felix es comerciante y se dedica ala venta de calzados por catálogo como Andrea, Mega Shoes y Terra. Así tiene negocio propio con el que lleva ya casi 9 años. Ella nos cuenta que necesita traer todos los pedidos que le piden sus clientes para así poder ver sus ganancias, pero si no tiene dinero suficiente no puede comprar toda la mercancía. Planea invertir su próximo préstamo para no hacer esperar a sus clientes hasta que junte su dinero, mientras mas invierte mas ganancias obtiene nos platica.

Mara Felix es unas de las integrantes del grupo Maranatha. Este grupo está integrado por 9 mujeres y 1 hombre que a continuación serán mencionados junto con cada una de las actividades que realizan: Silveria vende diferentes tipos de refacciones para autos, Isabel vende pan, Maria Felix vende calzado, Maria Elizabeth vende comida, Yosa Handi vende productos de abarrotes, Johana también vende productos de abarrotes, Socorro igual vende abarrotes, Hortencia vende refacciones para autos, Ivett vende comida y por último Pablo compra llantas y hace servicios mecánico.
texts.en:
Maria Felix is a hard-working and responsible person. She is forty years old and married to her husband, Victor, who works for Coca-Cola. They have four children who are currently in school. The eldest, who is seventeen years old, is in the second year of high school. Victor, who is fifteen years old, is in the second year of junior high school. Alejandra is nine years old and in the third year of elementary school. The youngest is eight years old and in the second year of elementary school. They all study in the municipality of Florencio Villarreal.

Maria Felix is a businesswoman who sells shoes from the Andrea, Mega Shoes, and Terra catalogs. She has had her own business for nine years. She tells us that she needs to bring together all the requests her customers make so she can see a profit, but if she does not have enough money, she cannot purchase all the merchandise she needs. She plans on investing her next loan so she will not have to make her clients wait until she collects all her money. She tells us that the more she invests, the more profits she earns.

Maria Felix is one of the members of the Maranatha Group. This group consists of nine women and one man, who are listed below, along with the type of work they do: Silveria sells spare parts for automobiles; Isabel sells bread; Maria Felix sells shoes; Maria Elizabeth sells food; Yosa Handi sells groceries; Johana also sells groceries; Socorro sells groceries, as well; Hortencia sells spare parts for automobiles; Ivett sells food; and, finally, Pablo purchases tires and is a mechanic.

loans.use: invest in more merchandise, such as shoes sold from catalogs.

location.town: Cruz Grande, Municipio Florencio Villareal, Estado

loans.name: Ranulfa

texts.en: Ranulfa supports her family by raising hogs. She currently needs additional capital to sustain her business. She plans to purchase pig feed and vitamins. Ranulfa works hard to improve her business. She hopes to be able to sustain her business while covering family expenses. She also hopes to expand her piggery in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and vitamins

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He supports his wife and she depends on him, especially to be able to have a good family and children.

Mohammad has been selling construction supplies since 2010, waiting for the perfect time to grow in this field. He is now looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more construction supplies such as rocks, sand and many other items. In the future, he plans to better develop his work and earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase more construction supplies such as rocks, sand, etc.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks such as soda and beer. 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks such as beer and soda for resale, and will help Jennifer to generate greater profits and increase her business. Jennifer hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start up another business. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as beer and soda for resale

loans.name: Manasi

texts.en:
Manasi is 48 years old and lives in the town of Packwach in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past four years, Manasi has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Manasi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale and will help Manasi to generate greater profits, which he plans to use for the family's medical expenses and for school fees for his children. Manasi hopes that in the future he will be able to buy a motorcycle to earn more income. 

Manasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Manasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale.

loans.name: Avtandil

texts.en:
Avtandil is 43 years old. He lives in a small village with his family: his wife, Tsismari; his 17-year-old son, who still goes to school; and his parents, who are pensioners. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, Avtandil has livestock and produces dairy food. Also, he has a plot of land, where he grows various vegetables. His wife is a very hard-working woman and helps him in his business. She sells the harvested products and dairy food in nearby villages. The whole family works hard but still lives in poverty. Their total average monthly income is 250 Lari, which is not enough even for everyday expenses. 

Avtandil requested a loan for purchasing sheep. He will grow them and after the sheep are grown, he will be able to produce more dairy food and sell it on the local open market. Avtandil will shave his sheep and sell wool and will sell lambs in the spring. Thus, he will earn additional income. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in his family's agricultural business. This will positively influence the income of the family. Due to the above mentioned living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Heba

texts.en: Heba is a 31-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children, who are still attending school. With the cooperation of her husband, Heba has been able to cover her family's needs and pay her children’s study fees. Her husband has been working as a blacksmith. As for her, she started to work as a tailor from her home in 2007, and already has many years of experience in this domain. Today, she wants to take a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new sewing machine in addition to some textiles, which will allow her to increase her productivity and thus her profits. In the future, she plans to open her own clothing shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine in addition to some textiles.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 34 years old. He lives in a small village with his family: his wife, Pati, and two children (6 and 1.5 years old). George runs an agricultural business. He has cattle, produces cheese, and sells it on the local open market. He is a very hard-working man and keeps his livestock in good conditions. He is busy with farming also. He has one hectare of land where he grows potatoes, corn, and haricot. The total average monthly income of the family is 300 Lari.

George requested a loan for purchasing milking cows. He will be able to produce and sell more dairy food. Thus, he wants to expand his business in order to earn the desired profit. With increased profits, he will be able to reinvest in his family's agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family's daily needs and the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase milking cows.

loans.name: Gretta

texts.en:
Gretta is a 22-year-old Lebanese single woman. She’s living with her parents who are both working to satisfy the family's demands and live as it should. 

Gretta started to work as a beautician in 2009. She has her loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and elegant style. Today she’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to renew her beauty supplies. She notes that this will improve her business and allow her to attract more clients. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and open her own beauty salon.

loans.use: to renew her beauty supplies

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 28 years old, is married and has one child. He runs a motorcycle transport business and his wife sells charcoal to provide the family with additional income. James has been in the transport business for three years. 

This will be James' first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use it to buy more charcoal for his wife's business. The anticipated profits will be used to pay school fees for his child and to provide basic needs for the family.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for his wife's business

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is married and has a single child who is enrolled in school. She has operated a salon for the last 10 years. Mwanakombo is requesting this loan to purchase beauty items and chemicals for her salon.

Mwanakombo lives in a rented house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes seasonality to be her major challenge and food for the family to be her greatest monthly expense. Mwanakombo joined Yehu to get financial support. She dreams of opening a boutique in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beauty items and chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three working siblings. Mohammad helps his father, who takes care of the family and covers the heavy life expenses. Despite his young age, Mohammad started his own work in 2010. He has been working as a car mechanic and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services.

Mohammad is now looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new mechanical tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly and honestly is really essential to building such a good and solid career. In the future, Mohammad plans to open a bigger garage and serve more people.

loans.use: to buy new mechanical tools for his business

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 32-year-old Lebanese single man. He is living with his parents and one sibling. His father is the one taking care of the family and responding to their needs. 

Unlike others of his age, Shadi started to work very early expecting to help his father with their expenses. He has been working as a plumber since 2002 on a free-lance basis and has a fair number of clients asking for his services. 

Today, he is in need of a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business. He notes that he is willing to take bigger projects and this Kiva loan will help him to achieve his goal. 

In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing equipment shop.

loans.use: to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is a married woman who has six children. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. To support her family, she sells soft drinks and coconut wine to her community. She works hard to grow her business and increase her daily income. She plans to use her loan to buy more soft drinks and coconut wine to sell. Elena hopes to have a bigger sari-sari (variety) store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 52 years old and lives in the town of Packwach in the Arua region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 6 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 20 years, Jennifer has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Jennifer has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh food like Irish potatoes for the restaurant, and will help Jennifer to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Jennifer hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another side business. 

Jennifer is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jennifer who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fresh food like Irish potatoes for the restaurant

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man with two boys and a girl, all of whom are in school. He lives in his own house that has electricity but no piped water. For the last five years, he has been operating a business selling hardware to the general public. In addition, he owns a rental house which earns him other sources of income. Charles dreams of owning a wholesale business in the future. He joined Yehu to get access to loans.

The loan of 40,000 KES will enable him to purchase timber and also renovate his rental house.

loans.use: to purchase timber and also renovate his rental house

loans.name: San Pedro Pablo Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado San Pedro Pablo  es de la Ciudad de Carapeguá. Actualmente el grupo con mucho sacrificio ya está en el 7º ciclo con 17 integrantes, de lo que se puede destacar que ellas son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en salir adelante.
Justa forma parte del grupo, y ella nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella es una persona con muchas esperanzas, que quiere salir adelante y de esa forma poder ayudar a su familia y a la vez cumplir su sueño de ser una gran microempresaria.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de tomates, locotes, cebollas, lechugas y demás verduras, para poder surtir su negocio y dar mayor variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Pedro Pablo group is from the city of Carapeguá. Currently, the group has made many sacrifices and is in its seventh loan cycle, with seventeen members. These women are hard-working and do their best to get ahead.
Justa is one of the members of the group. She tells us that she sells fruits and vegetables. She is a person with lots of hope who wants to get ahead so she can help her family and also realize her dream of being a successful microbusinesswoman.
She is requesting the loan so she can purchase tomatoes, peppers, onions, lettuce, and other vegetables so she can stock her business and provide her customers with more variety.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon, 29 years old, is married and has no children. For the past 3 years, he has operated a motorcycle transport business (locally known as boda boda) and a bureau service. Simon earns a monthly income of 45,000 KES. 

This will be Simon's first loan from KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to service his motorcycle to improve his business. Simon plans to use the profits to open another bureau shop in Kawangware. In the future, Simon plans to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: To service his motorcycle

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is a 61-year-old married woman with five children. Her husband works as a rice farmer. 

Severina supports her family through raising hogs. She has been in this business for fifteen years and earns about 5,000 PHP per month. She requested this loan to purchase pig feed and farm fertilizers. 

Severina hopes for her family to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is thirty-six years old. She supports eight members of her family. She is married to Samuel, who is teacher and supports the business. She has four children, ages eighteen, fifteen, thirteen, and eleven years old respectively. 

She has been selling second-hand clothes for twelve years. Her monthly salary is 16,700 shillings per month. This will be her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of clothes for sale in her business.

She intends to use the anticipated profits from the business for business expansion.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Iuri

texts.en:
Iuri is 59 years old. He lives in a small village with his family: his wife, Marina, and a 17-year-old daughter. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, Iuri and Marina have livestock; they produce cheese and sell on the local open market.

The family members are busy with farming also. They have 1 hectare of land where potatoes, corn and haricot (beans) are grown. Iuri is busy during the whole day; he works hard to earn income for their living. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 lari.

Iuri requested a loan for the family's agricultural business. With this loan he will be able to cultivate the family-owned land and sow potatoes. He and Marina will work hard, especially in spring and summer seasons, to get a good harvest. After selling potatoes, the family will get additional income, so he wants to expand his agricultural business. With an increased amount of profit, he will be able to reinvest in the family's agricultural business. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to cultivate land and sow potatoes

loans.name: Walter

texts.en:
Walter is 33 years old and lives in the town of Pakwach in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children, with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Walter has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Walter has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Walter to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his two children. Walter hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another side business. 

Walter is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Walter who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 19-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his one parent and five working siblings. Najah cooperates with the whole family to satisfy their needs and live properly. Najah started working in construction in 2010; he works independently on a free-lance basis and looks forward to taking on more projects.

Najah is now requesting a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed equipment to start a new project. This loan will improve his work, and therefore his way of living. In the future, Najah plans to take on bigger construction projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase needed equipment to start a new project

loans.name: Rami

texts.en:
Rami is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man who lives with his parents and one sibling. His father works hard to enhance his family's standard of living. In order to help his father, Rami started his own business as a DJ and wedding organizer two years ago. He attends weddings, parties and any kind of event upon customers’ requests.

Rami now wants to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new sound system equipment and decoration items for his business. This loan will improve his work and allow him to attend more and bigger events. In the future, Rami plans to open his own events organizing company.

loans.use: to purchase new sound system equipment and decoration items for his business

loans.name: Nganga

texts.en:
Nganga is married and has four children. He sells goats to earn a living and has been in the business for ten years. He has employed one person in the business. Besides, he is a farmer.  

He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills. He has requested 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy goats.

He hopes to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy goats.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 48 years old and lives in the town of Packwach in the Arua region of Uganda. She is widowed and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 4 years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her bar, where she sells drinks like soda and beer. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sodas and beer for resale, and will help Oliver to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Oliver hopes that in the future she will be able to to buy a fridge to be used in the bar. 

Oliver is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Oliver who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more sodas and beer for resale

loans.name: Inga

texts.en:
Inga is 36 years old; she lives in a small village of Samtskhe Javakheti Region, South Georgia with her family: her husband - Gela, and two children (15 and 17 years old), who study in the local school. Gela is a building worker and works in nearby villages.  Inga has been running the family agricultural business for almost 20 years. She is busy with farming; she has a plot of land where she grows potatoes. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Lari.

Inga requested a loan for purchasing fertilizer and chemicals for healing plants from parasites. She will cultivate land and fertilize it. She will sow various vegetables and fruits there. She will work hard and hopes to get more and better produce. Inga will sell harvested produce on the local open market. After selling the produce, she will get planned income and Inga will be able to continue financing the  education of her daughter, who plans to enter a high school this fall.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and chemicals for healing plants from parasites

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 38 years old and lives in the town of Paidha in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past six years, Alex has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Alex has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help Alex to generate greater profits and pay school fees, food and medical bills for his family. Alex hopes that in the future he will be able to get another loan from BRAC. 

Alex is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alex who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 35 years old and lives in the town of Paidha in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, James has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale. It will help James to generate greater profits and pay for food and medical expenses for his family. James hopes that in the future he will be able to sart a side business with more profits. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale

loans.name: Jennys Group

texts.es:
JENNYS ES UN GRUPO SOLIDARIO DE CREDITUYO SE ENCUENTRA EN SU PRIMER CICLO, ESTA INTEGRADO POR SEIS PERSONAS. ELLAS SON AMIGAS Y VECINAS DESDE HACE VARIOS AÑOS. EL GRUPO LLEVA ESE NOMBRE POR UNA DE LAS INTEGRATES QUE DE CARIÑO LE LLAMAN JENNY Y GRACIAS A ELLA SE FORMÓ EL GRUPO.

REYNA ISABEL ES UNA DE LAS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO, ELLA TIENE UN NEGOCIO DE ABARROTES EN SU DOMICILIO DESDE HACE MAS DE 3AÑOS. ES CASADA, CON 4 HIJOS DE 14,13,9 Y 4 AÑOS. A REYNA LE GUSTA MUCHO SU TRABAJO YA QUE PUEDE ESTAR CON SU FAMILIA Y TABAJANDO AL MISMO TIEMPO, CON LO QUE PUEDEN CONVIVIR TODOS JUNTOS. CON SU PRESTAMO, LA SRA REYNA QUIERE COMPRAR MAS ABARROTES Y ASI TENER MAS SURTIDA SU TIENDA, ELLA QUIERE TENER MAS VARIEDAD PARA AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS.
 
REYNA ISABEL EN UN FUTURO QUIERE QUE SU NEGOCIO LLEGUE A SER MAS GRANDE Y TENER OTROS LOCALES PARA QUE LO PUEDAN TRABAJAR SUS HIJOS
texts.en:
Jennys is a loan support group that is in it's first cycle.  It contains six people who have been friends and neighbors for various years.  The group is named after one of the members whom they call Jenny out of affection.  It is thanks to her that the group was formed. 

Reyna Isabel is one the members of the group.  She has had a grocery store out of her home for the last 3 years.  She is married, with 4 children who are 14,13, 9, and 4 years old.  Reyna likes her work since she can be with her family and work at the same time, as much as they can all get along together.  With her loan, Mrs. Reyna wants to buy more groceries and be able to supply her store.  She wants to have more variety to increase her sales.   
 
In the future Reyna Isabel wants her business to get bigger and have other storefronts so that her children can work in them.

loans.use: Buy grocery products to have better inventory in her store.

loans.name: Esperanza 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Esperanza 2 tiene 13 integrantes en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea, con la cual desean ayudar a sus familias. Las señoras se sienten muy emocionadas, la ayuda mutua entre ellas es constante y por sobre todo las inspira las ganas de seguir luchando por sus familias.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Irina, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas. Ella con mucho sacrificio y dedicación ha podido salir adelante e ir mejorando de a poco su pequeño negocio. Su meta es poder tener una gran tienda y así poder tener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con lo que podrá surtirse y a la vez poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The community bank group 'Esperanza 2' [Hope 2] has 13 members. All of the members have a small business which provides them with income to be able to help their families.  The women are very excited about their group, the mutual help within the group is a constant support, and above all they are all inspired to continue working to help their families get ahead. 

One of the women is Irina, who makes a living selling clothing. With much sacrifice and dedication she has been able to get ahead and make improvements little by little to her small business. Her goal is to have a large store, so that she can increase her profits, to help her family. She has requested a loan to buy more clothing, which she will be able to stock her business with and be able to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing to resell.

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa, 43 years old, is married and has 3 children aged 8, 13 and 16. Her husband works as a farmer and carpenter.

For the past 3 years, Rufa has operated a business raising hogs, earning 5,000 PHP monthly. She also makes fans and hats from dried buri palm leaves. Rufa works hard to help provide for her household's increasing needs. She requested a loan to purchase piglets and feed. Rufa hopes to have increased sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to purchase piglets and feed

loans.name: Murman

texts.en:
Murman is 52 years old. He lives in a small village with his wife, Zaira. They run an agricultural business. 

They have a milking cow and every day they actively produce cheese, curd, and other dairy food and sell dairy products on the local open market. They have a lot of customers in nearby villages because everyone knows that their products are of good quality. 

Along with the dairy farm, the family is busy on a family-owned cornfield. They sell harvested corn on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 Lari.

Murman requested a loan for purchasing drugs for healing the cornfield from parasites. As a result of this properly done seasonal work, the harvest will be better and Murman will be able to sell it at a good price. With the increased amount of profit, he will be able to repair the first floor of his house and the family will have better living conditions.

Murman hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase drugs for healing plants from parasites.

loans.name: Ambrosia

texts.en: Ambrosia is 50 years old and is a married woman with two children ages 13 and 18. She does farming for a living. She has been growing and selling rice for 14 years. Ambrosia is able to provide for her family through her business. She requested a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. Ambrosia hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is married and has two children.  He practices livestock farming to earn a living.  He has been in the business for six years.  He has employed one person in the business.  He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained in business management skills.  

John hopes to grow his business and employ more people.  He has requested 25,000 Kenya shillings to buy cows.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Kyalo

texts.en: Kyalo is 31 years old, married, and has two children. He sells cereals to earn a living. He has been in the business for four years. He has employed one person in the business. He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills. He hopes to grow his business and employ more people. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy cereals.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Tinga

texts.en:
Tinga is a man with four children, two of whom are enrolled in school. For the last three years, he has been operating a furniture-selling business, selling to the general public. His goal is to open a wood workshop in future. 

Tinga lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. He describes seasonality to be his major challenge and food to be his greatest monthly expense. Tinga joined Yehu to get financial support.

The loan of Ksh 40,000 will enable him to purchase timber and woodworking equipment.

loans.use: purchase timber and woodworking equipment.

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn is 45 years old and is a married woman with a 6-year-old child. Her husband works as a farmer.

Merilyn has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for eight years. She sells snacks, toiletries, canned goods and other various items. She also sells food supplements to her community. Merilyn earns 6000 PHP per month with her business. She hopes to increase her daily income and help provide for her family's increasing needs. 

Merilyn requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and food supplements. This will help increase Merilyn's sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods and food supplements

loans.name: Chibaty Group

texts.es: Amelia tiene con 59 años de edad es una mujer muy trabajadora y con ganas de tener una mejor calidad de vida platica que donde vive es una comunidad muy bonita y pintoresca ya que a su alrededor se encuentran los cerros llenos de pinos los cuales de ahí sacan la materia prima para hacer sus artesanías en ocoshal, también comenta que le agrada vivir ahí porque ahí está su cultura bien arraigada ya que la mayoría de las personas hablan y visten el mazahua. Amelia es viuda y tuvo 5 hijos ya todos casados y vive sola dice que desde hace dos años se dedica a cultivar aguacate para después venderlo, también platica que hace sus artesanías desde hace más de diez años que una monja les enseño hacer artículos de ocoshal para vender. Ella está pidiendo un crédito a la financiera para la compra de material para hacer sus artesanías de ocoshal como hilo, agujas, jabón y cloro para lavar el ocoshal ella hace canastos, tortilleras, paneras, floreros, tapetes, alhajeros y muchas otras cosas mas. También invertirá el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes para darles una mejor calidad a su arboles de aguacate. Dice que aunque todavía son pequeños los arboles ella espera en el mes de diciembre ver su primera cosecha y ahora si obtendrá ganancias de estos arbolitos. Platica que esta emocionada por que gracias al crédito mejorara las condiciones de sus aguacate y ella espera que con las ganancias de la primera cosecha comprara una bomba para subir el agua hasta su terreno ya  que abeces le cuesta trabajo subir con cubetas al cerro para echarle agua a sus arbolitos. Las otras tres integrantes se llaman María Leucadia, Irma y María Crisanta ellas invertirán sus créditos en la compra de insumos para cultivar aguacate y para la compra de material para hacer artesanías de ocoshal.
texts.en:
Amelia is 59 years old and is a very hardworking woman who wants to improve her quality of life.  She lives in a very beautiful and picturesque community that is surrounded by pine-covered hills; the pine trees provide Amelia with a source of raw material for the Ocoshal [woven pine fiber] crafts she makes.  Amelia enjoys living in her community because her culture is deeply rooted there, since most of the locals speak the Mazahua language and wear traditional Mazahua clothing.  

Amelia is widowed and has 5 children, all of them married.  She has lived alone for two years.  She makes a living growing and selling avocados.  She also makes handicrafts to sell, which she has done ever since a nun taught her how to make Ocoshal crafts more than ten years ago.  Amelia is asking for a loan so she can purchase materials she needs for making Ocoshal handicrafts, such as needles and thread, as well as soap and bleach for washing the pine fibers.  She weaves the fibers into baskets, tortilla baskets, breadbaskets, vases, mats, jewelry boxes, and many other items.  

Amelia is also going to use the loan to purchase fertilizer and insecticide in order to improve the quality of her avocado trees.  She says that even though her trees are small right now, she expects to get her first avocado crop in December and will definitely earn a profit from her trees.  Amelia is excited about the loan because it will allow her to improve the quality of her avocados.  She hopes to use the profits from her first crop to purchase a pump for bringing water up to her land, since she has difficulty walking up the hill carrying buckets of water and then watering her trees by hand.

The other three members of the group are María Leucadia, Irma, and María Crisanta.  Like Amelia, they are also going to use their shares of the loan to purchase supplies for growing avocados as well as materials for making Ocoshal handicrafts.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for growing avocados such as fertilizer and insecticide, and to purchase materials for making Ocoshal handicrafts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn, firewood and lime.

loans.name: Iddi

texts.en:
Iddi is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with four of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Iddi has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells dry food like maize and beans. 

To help expand his business, Iddi has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce like maize for resale and will help Iddi to generate greater profits and add more working capital for his business. Iddi hopes that in the future he will be able to become a big supplier in town. 

Iddi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Iddi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more produce like maize for resale

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with two children, both attending school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Beatrice has been selling clothes, shoes, and kitchenware door-to-door, a business she has operated for the last three years. She dreams of opening a wholesale business in future. Other sources of income include earnings from her husband. Seasonality is her challenge. 

Beatrice plans to use the loan of Ksh 10,000 to purchase stock of shoes, clothes, and kitchenware.

loans.use: to purchase stock of shoes, clothes, and kitchenware.

loans.name: Flasiah

texts.en: Flasiah is married and has four children. She practices arable farming to earn a living. She also does dairy farming to supplement her income. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills. Flasiah hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future. She has requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Bienvenido

texts.en: Bienvenido is a 52-year-old married man with three children. He lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with his family. He has had a tricycle business for eight years now. He earns 5,000 PHP per month transporting people around his community. Bienvenido works hard to provide for his family and to send his children to school. He requested this loan to purchase tricycle spare parts and tires and to pay for repairs. He hopes for his income to increase and for his children to finish college and have bright futures.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle spare parts and tires and to pay for repairs.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 38 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past two years, Emmanuel has been working hard to manage his bar, which sells drinks like soda and beer. 

To help expand his business, Emmanuel has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks like beer and soda for resale, and will help Emmanuel to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Emmanuel hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business more. 

Emmanuel is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Emmanuel who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks like beer and soda for resale

loans.name: Jose Manrique

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y un hijo, él se dedica a un taller de estructuras metálicas y tambien presta sus servicios como motorista, aprendió como ayudante luego empezó a instalar su propio negocio de estructuras, se compro su propio vehículo y tiene una experiencia de 2 años. 
El esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de hierro para el taller, ya que está realizando unos trabajos que le han solicitado, tambien le hará reparaciones al vehículo en el cual se transporte con sus trabajos, con este préstamo podrá mejorar la disponibilidad de hierro en el negocio, y darle al vehículo el mantenimiento necesario. 
Su objetivo es mejorar sus condiciones y la capacidad del taller, para poder estabilizar los ingresos a la familia.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and one son.  He works in a metal workshop that creates metal frames and he also lends his services as a driver.  He started as an apprentice and then later began establishing his own business of constructing metal frames.  He bought his own car and has 2 years of experience in the industry.  

He is asking for a loan to purchase iron for his metal workshop which he needs to finish some of the projects that have been requested of him.  He will also repair the vehicle he uses to transport his projects.  With this loan he will be able to improve his business by increasing the amount of iron available as well as give his vehicle the necessary maintenance.  

His objective is to improve the conditions and the capacity of the iron workshop in order to stabilize his family's income.

loans.use: tp purchase iron for his metal workshop.

loans.name: Espiga Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama espiga y se integra de tres  personas, cada uno se dedica a su respectiva actividad y todos ellos viven en un pueblo llamado Luis Espinoza.

     Virginio  quien está casado con la señora  Elisa con quien procreo un hijo que aún está a su responsabilidad y estudia en secundaria.

   El solicitó el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de madera para elaborar muebles como son: sillas, comedores, roperos, entre otros en donde lleva trabajando  veinte años y cinco meses en la que comenta que le va bien ya que con ello a estado saliendo adelante con su familia que es lo más importante para él.

   Inició con esta actividad desde muy joven ya que aprendió de chalan (ayudante) y con el tiempo decidió  poner su propia carpintería, en donde pudiera obtener su propios ingresos y le va bien.

    Lo que desea es que con esta pequeña actividad y el préstamo él pueda seguir trabajando y dando trabajo a otras  personas que le ayudan a lijar y barnizar los muebles.

    Quienes integran en el grupo son:

   Enrique quien invertirá en barnices y madera para su carpintería y la señora Josefa invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Espiga," and it is made up of 3 people who each have their own businesses.  They all live in the town called Luis Espinoza.  Virginio is married to Elisa, and together they have a son who is still in their care and is in middle school.  He is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wood to make furniture, such as: chairs, dining tables, armoires, and other items.  He has been doing this work for 20 years and 5 months, and he comments that it is going well, because with this business he has been able to get ahead with his family, and for him, this is the most important thing.

He started doing this work when he was very young, because he learned this trade from a skilled tradesman.  Eventually, he decided to establish his own carpentry workshop where he could obtain his own income, and it is going very well for him.

What he wants is that with this small business and this loan, he will be able to continue to work and provide work for other people who help him to sand and varnish the furniture.

The members of this communal bank are:  Enrique, who will invest the loan in varnishes and wood for his carpentry business, and Josefa, who will invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients to make tamales.

loans.use: to buy wood to use making furniture

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad, la vivienda es familiar, hace 20 años su padre le heredo la panadería, hasta el momento la administra bien, continuando la producción y manteniendo la clientela.
El solicita un préstamo porque necesita realizar la reparación del horno comprándose algunos repuestos y tambien comprara materia prima como la harina, azúcar, levadura, y otros. Este préstamo le ayudara a solventar la necesidad de reparar el horno industrial y tambien disponer de materiales para la producción.
El objetivo de José es prosperar en el negocio, en un futuro comprarse otro vehículo para distribuir el pan.
texts.en:
José lives with his wife and their two children, who are 9 and 6 years old, in their family home. Twenty years ago he inherited a bakery from his father. Up to this point he has run the business well, continued the production and also maintained the customer base. 

He has requested a loan because he needs to make a repair to his oven and also needs to buy raw materials like flour, sugar, yeast and other ingredients. This loan will help him resolve the issue of repairing his oven and also make available the materials he needs for production. 

Jose's goal is to improve the business and in the future buy another vehicle to distribute bread.

loans.use: to repair his oven and to buy flour, sugar, yeast and other ingredients.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 54 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has three children with one of them currently in school. For the past five years, John has been working hard to manage his health clinic which sells medicine. 

To help expand his business, John has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more medicine for the clinic for resale, and will help John to generate greater profits in his business. John hopes that in the future he will be able to open up another clinic. 

John is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for the clinic for resale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is married and has three children. She runs a retail shop to earn a living. She has been in the business since 2007. She also does farming to supplement her income. She has grown her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained in business management skills.  
She hopes to grow her business more and employ people.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, and salt.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, maize flour, and salt.

loans.name: Dionesio

texts.en: Dionesio is a 52-year-old fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He is married and has seven children. Dionesio supports his family through fishing. He needs additional capital to sustain his business. He plans to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other materials. Dionesio hopes for his fishing business to become successful. He also hopes to elevate his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and other materials

loans.name: Las Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Las Estrellas y está conformado por ocho personas trabajadoras y humildes con deseos de engrandecer sus  negocios.
Las personas de  este grupo son originarias de Jamiltepec, Oaxaca donde  la mayoría de sus ciudadanos hablan  el idioma mixteco.
Las comidas típicas de la región son la barbacoa, mole y tamales de iguana.
algunas de sus artesanías son: son los catarros ollas y cómales entre la decorativa encontramos quemadores de copal y figuras de animales.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Esther de veintinueve años de edad, una señora trabajadora y alegre.
Doña Esther se dedica a la venta y elaboración de blusas artesanales y a la elaboración de pantalones, vestidos y batas de tela.
Comenta que  lleva bordando cinco años y cosiendo diez años, le gustan mucho sus negocios por que hace lo que más le gusta.
Tiene dos hijos Alexis y Ander sus mas grandes tesoros, es madre soltera pero con su negocio les ha podido dar una mejor vida a sus hijos.
Donde tiene mas trabajo es el 15 de febrero que es la fiesta del pueblo ya que las señoras van para que les haga su traje.
Ella pidió el crédito para la compra de mas mercancía para la elaboración de blusas batas como son manta, listones hilos de colores, botones y manta de color.
Las otras integrantes  del grupo son:
Maria Flora- se dedica a la venta de bordados.
Resalia- se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos.
Agustina- se dedica a la venta de artesanías.
Margarita Teresa- se dedica a la venta de pescados.
Leovigilda- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Ondina- se dedica a la venta de comida.
Bernardo- se dedica a la venta de carnes.

Le dan las gracias a fundacion por ayudarlos para que  su vida mejoren y puedan  engrandecer sus negocios.
texts.en:
This group is called Las Estrellas [The Stars], and consists of eight hard-working and humble people who wish to enlarge their businesses.
The people in this group are from Jamiltepec, Oaxaca, where most of the citizens speak Mixtec [an indigenous language].
The typical food in the region includes barbecue, mole [dishes made with a chile sauce], and iguana tamales.
Some of the local crafts are: cooking pots and griddles, along with decorative copal burners and animal figures.
One of the group’s members is Esther, who is twenty-nine years old. She is a happy and hard-working woman.
Esther makes and sells hand-crafted blouses, and she also makes pants, dresses, and cloth dressing gowns.
She says that she has been doing embroidery for five years, and sewing for ten years. She likes her business because she is doing the thing she enjoys most.
She has two children, Alexis and Ander, who are her biggest treasures. She is a single mother, but her business has helped her to be able to provide her children with a better life.
She has more work during the town festival of February 15 since women ask her to make outfits for them.
She has requested the loan to purchase more merchandise so she can make blouses and dressing gowns. Some of these items are cloth, ribbons, colored thread, buttons, and dyed cloth.
The other members of the group are:
Maria Flora – she sells embroidery
Resalia – she sells Mexican sweets
Agustina – she sells handicrafts
Margarita Teresa – she sells fish
Leovigilda – she sells food
Ondina – she sells food
Bernardo – he sells meats
They are thankful to the Foundation for helping them to improve their lives and to be able to enlarge their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make hand-crafted clothing.

loans.name: Dioscora

texts.en: Dioscora runs a sari-sari store in Talibon, Bohol. She is able to provide for her family's daily needs with her income. Dioscora needs additional capital for her business. She plans to buy more merchandise (such as canned goods and softdrinks) to sell. Dioscora is hoping for her sales and profitability to increase so she can continue covering family expenses. She also hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (such as canned goods and soft drinks) to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is married and has three children.  He runs a tailoring business to earn a living.  He has been in the business for eight years.  He has employed one person.  He has grown his business since he joined Faulu Kenya because he has been trained on business management skills.  

He hopes to grow his business and employ more people.  He has requested 60, 000 Kenya shillings to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is a sari-sari store owner living in the town of Talibon, Bohol, with her family. Her husband is a fisherman.

Anabelle sells items such as toiletries, canned goods, coffee, sugar, and noodles. She helps in providing for her family's basic needs. She also supports her husband's fishing by selling his catch at the market. Anabelle plans to use her loan to purchase fishing nets and additional merchandise to sell. She hopes to earn more and be able to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фарида женщина в возрасте 29 лет трудолюбивая,ответственная женщина,замужем, и имеет двоих детей.Так как у нее нету образования и она не где не работает она решила заняться откормам скота и уже этим видом деятельности занимается более 6 лет.Фарида знает все трудности и приимущество этого бизнеса.Дома у нее имеется 2  коровы и теленок. В связи с переходом на летний сезон клиентка хочет на полученный кредит закупить скот,и откормив  их хочет продать за хорошую цену.Она надеется на вашу помощь и заренее благодарит.
texts.en: Farida is a 29 year old woman, she is hardworking and responsible, married and has two children. She does not have education and does not work anywhere, so she decided to start feeding cattle and has been in this business for more than six years. Farida knows all the difficulties and advantages of this business. She has two cows and a calf. With the transition into the summer season she wants to use the received loan to buy livestock and then sell for a better price after feeding it. Farida hopes for your help and is thanking in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala east region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Francis has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar and soap. 

To help expand his business, Francis has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities for resale, and will help Francis to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Francis hopes that in the future he will be able to expand more in his business. 

Francis is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Francis who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities for resale.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with 6 children aged between 9 and 24 years old. She and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband operates their fishing boat to catch fish. Esterlita then sells his catch at the market. She also provides tailoring services to her community to help augment the family income.

Esterlita is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets, lead weights and tailoring materials. She hopes to have sufficient income to sustain her family, especially her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets, lead weights and tailoring materials

loans.name: Bertha Margarita

texts.es:
Bertha es una señora que se considera una persona positiva, triunfadora y muy responsable. Vive con sus dos hijos en Latacunga que se encuentra en la Provincia de Cotopaxi.

Bertha trabaja sola en su hogar en la compra venta de cerdos, negocio que le ayuda a sustentar algunos gastos de su hogar, al momento tiene algunos cerdos que estan en proceso de engorde, el crédito que solicita a Fodemi es para la compra de crías de cerdos blancos para crianza y reproducción, debido a que estos tienen mucha demenda en el mercado, también el crédito utilizará en la construcción de corrales para sus animales y en la alimentación como balanceado. Este proceso ayudará a Bertha a tener más cerdos en su haber y poder criarlos para su posterior venta que a su vez generará un incremento en sus ingresos y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de los suyos.

Bertha sueña en tener más cerditos para que sus hijos sigan con el negocio.
texts.en:
Bertha is a woman who is known as a positive, successful and very responsible person. She lives with her two children in Latacunga, which is located in the Province of Cotopaxi.

Bertha works alone at her home buying and selling pigs. This business helps her cover some expenses of her household. At the moment, she has some pigs which are in the process of being fattened up. The loan she is requesting from FODEMI is to buy piglets of the white pig variety to raise and breed, because there is great demand for these on the market. She will also use the loan in the construction of pens for her animals and to buy feed such as commercial balanced feed. This process will help Bertha have more pigs in her business and be able to raise them for later sale, which in turn will generate an increase in her income, so that she can improve the quality of life for her loved ones. 

Bertha's dream is to have more piglets so her children can continue the business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and breed, and also to construct pens for them.

loans.name: Gladis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Gladis, es comerciante de bisutería, vive con su hija en casa propia, Gladis es pensionada, tiene tres años en el negocio fabricando aretes, collares, pulseras de manera artesanal.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales, como piedras, dijes, alambre, broches, tenazas para realizar el proceso, esto le ayudara a mejorar la oportunidad de producir, manteniendo lo mas surtido para la clientela.
Su aspiración es crecer, ampliarse en la zona con más clientes, instalar un puesto fijo dentro del mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Gladis' business is selling jewelry.  She is a pensioner, lives with her daughter, and owns her own home.  For three years she has been in business making earrings, necklaces and bracelets by hand.  She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as stones, charms, wire, clasps and pliers so that she can continue in her work.  This will help her to improve her production and have as much stock available for her customers as she can.

Gladis' goal is to grow in her business and expand in her area, attracting more customers.  She would like to have a fixed sales location within the town market.

loans.use: to buy stones, charms, wire, clasps and pliers

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix supports his family through fishing. He has been a fisherman for 10 years now. Felix needs additional capital for his fishing business. He plans to purchase a boat engine. Felix hopes to have increased business profitability. He hopes to pay his obligations, provide for his family's needs and pay for his children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a boat engine

loans.name: Ma. Gelinda

texts.en: Ma. Gelinda and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol. She sells her husband's catch at the market and also processes dried fish to sell. Ma. Gelinda works hard to sustain her family and keep her 6 children in good health. She requested a loan to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks, lead weights and floaters. She hopes that this loan will help increase their income and be able to provide for all their needs.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials such as nets, hooks, lead weights and floaters

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is 42 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children with 3 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Steven has been working hard to manage his poultry farm, which sells chicken. 

To help expand his business, Steven has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken feed, and will help Steven to generate greater profits and increase more capital in the business. Steven hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business.
