loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre kuña kyrey está  iniciándose en el 1er ciclo, en donde todas ellas trabajan en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Ellas hacen trabajos juntas y de esa forma poder formar un pequeño ahorro para poder enfrentar cualquier contratiempo que pueda llegar a tener.
La señora Sixta es una de las integrantes del comité quien se dedica a la costura de sabanas y fundas, y nos comenta que mediante su trabajo ella ha podido sacar adelante a su familia y ayudarles a tener una vida sin privaciones ni limitaciones.
Sixta solicita el crédito para comprar mas telas y abastece mejor con sus pedidos de esta manera vende muchos más juegos de sabanas y así  poder tener un mejor ingreso y mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia.
La señora Sixta agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por la oportunidad brindada ya que las actividades que realizan es muy importante y mediante ella pudieron desarrollar mejor y con menos inconveniente su trabajo.
texts.en:
The women's community bank Kuña Kyrey is beginning it's first cycle in which all of them work together and with solidarity within the program. They do jobs together and in this way are able to save a little, so that they can face whatever setbacks may arise. 

Sixta is one of the community bank members who makes a living by sewing sheets and covers. She tells us that through her job she has been able to get her family ahead and help them to have a life without hardships or restrictions. 

Sixta is asking for a loan to buy more fabric and to better stock up for her orders. In this way she will sell more sheet sets, so that she can earn a higher income and improve her and her family's standard of living. 

Sixta is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity they've offered, since the work they do is very important and through them they will develop further and with fewer drawbacks to their work.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Julia Mabel

texts.es: Julia Mabel de 22 años de edad, decidió dedicarse a la venta de ropa interior desde hace varios años. Ella habita junto a su esposo y su pequeña hija. Es una mujer increíble la cual hace todo lo que esté en sus manos para sacar adelante a su familia.  La venta de la ropa la realiza de manera ambulante, en las diferentes zonas donde habita.  Ha sabido ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes y de su vecinos que cada día la prefieren más, dado que es muy trabajadora, honesta, responsable y sobre todo carismática. Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que por mucho tiempo han vivido en condiciones muy humildes y quiere cambiar esa situación poco a poco. Una de las cosas que quiere hacer es mejorar las condiciones de su hogar ya que no cuenta con energía eléctrica y considera que es muy importante que su hija vaya creciendo en mejores condiciones. Debido a que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para hacer dicha mejora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para que le dé un empujoncito en la instalación de la energía eléctrica de su hogar.  Espera que con su trabajo y la ayuda de esta institución sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia vayan mejorando.
texts.en:
Julia Mabel is 22 years old and has been selling undergarments for several years. She lives with her husband and young daughter. Julia is an incredible woman who has done everything she can to move her family forward. She sells clothing as a traveling vendor, going to different areas where she lives. Julia has gained the trust of many customers and neighbors, more of whom prefer to do business with her each day, given that she is a hardworking, responsible, and charismatic woman.

Her dream is to improve the living conditions of her family. For the longest time, they have lived under very modest conditions, so Julia wants to change this situation a little bit at a time. One of things that she wants to do is to improve the conditions at home. She does not receive electricity and considers it to be very important for her daughter to have it so that she can grow under better conditions. Given that she does not have the necessary financial resources, Julia made the decision to request a loan from Apoyo Integral. This will nudge the process of getting electricity installed in her home. Julia is hopeful that her work and the help of Apoyo Integral will improve the living conditions for her and her family.

loans.use: to pay for electricity installation.

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El grupo primavera esta en el quinto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas han trabajado juntas y comentan que están muy a gusto en su grupo y que desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa.
La Sra. Leonarda, quien se viuda, se dedica a la docencia en el turno mañana y por la tarde vende ropas y comida. Se ve que es una persona muy trabajadora y con ganas de salir adelante.
Leonarda solicita el crédito para poder comprar ropas, y de esa forma poder tener un buen stock y variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la ayuda que ella y sus amigas han recibido.
texts.en:
The group "Primavera" (Spring) is in its fifth loan cycle with the Program of Women Entrepreneurs at Fundación Paraguaya. They have worked together and say that they get along well as a group and want to achieve the highest level in the program.

Sra. Leonarda is a widow and works as a teacher in the mornings. In the afternoons, she sells clothing and food. She is a hardworking person who has the drive to succeed. Leonarda is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing. This will enable her to have a good inventory and variety to offer to her customers. She is grateful for the help that she and her friends have received.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Ester is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

Ester has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and help her two children with their college education.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of buying and selling tuna in the Philippines. She is borrowing a loan of PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more tuna fish to sell.

Judith has been in this business for 16 years, and earns more income from fishing. 

She has sustained her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase more tuna to sell.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is from Campo 4, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 57 years old and married with two children. Anita used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. 

Her business is successful, and she is taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping. She hopes to be able to grow her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next cropping

location.town: Campo 4, Ramon MAgsaysay Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Marilyn is requesting a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for fishing such as fishing net, bamboo, etc.

Marilyn has been in this business for 10 years, and she would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing such as fishing net.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is is 50 years old, married and has nine children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Rosie has a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for 3 years, and she would like to save money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Villa Policial Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Villa Policial esta en el 1° ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Las miembros están empezando a trabajar juntas y fomentan su compañerismo por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas.
La Sra.  Clemencia se dedica a la pesca y nos comenta que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano a ir a pescar y de esa forma tratar de buscar el pan de cada día para su familia.  Ella desea poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de peces, con lo cual podrá surtirse y de esa forma tener mayores pescados para la venta. Agradece la oportunidad que ella y su grupo reciben.
texts.en:
The Committee of Women called "Villa Policial" is in its first loan cycle with the Program of Women Entrepreneurs. The members are starting to work together and have developed a camaraderie as a result.

Sra. Clemencia sells fish and says that she wakes up early every day to go fishing in order to provide for the daily needs of her family. She wants to keep working so that she can continue helping her family. Clemencia is requesting a loan to buy fish so that she can restock and have more fish to sell. She is grateful for the opportunity that she and the rest of her group have received.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El Sr. Vicente tiene 65 años, el se dedica al comercio hace 30 años cuenta con un pequeño comercio donde vende todo tipo de prendas, calzados, frazadas y demás, en su domicilio y también realiza ventas ambulantes, además se dedica al cultivo de Mandioca en una parcela con que cuenta a orillas de la cuidad.
El Sr. Vicente es un señor muy trabajador y desea que el país cambie que brinde más seguridad, educación y  por sobre todo trabajo a los más necesitados. El lucha por seguir creciendo y ser cada vez mejor.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados, prendas, frazadas y demás artículos ya que cuenta con muy buena demanda y pedidos con los que quiere cumplir.
texts.en:
Vicente is 65 years old. He has been a merchant for 30 years. He has sa small store in his house where he sells all types of clothing, shoes, blankets and more. He also sells as a street vendor and grows cassava on a parcel of land he has on the outskirts of town.

Vicente is a very hardworking man and he wants his country to change and offer more safety, education and above all work for the neediest. He is fighting to keep growing and get better and better. 

He is asking for the loan to buy choes, clothing, blankets and other items since there is good demand and orders that he wants to fill.

loans.use: to buy shoes, clothing, blankets and other items.

loans.name: Melva

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Melva works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from poultry. Melva is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional fishing materials for her fishing business.

Melva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to enable her two children to finish college.

loans.use: To buy additional fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children,  Merly works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines and earns additional income from an eatery. Merly is borrowing PHP 24,500 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Merly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro es comerciante, junto con su Esposa la Señora Maria atienden una pequeña despensa en su propia casa.
Pedro y su espora son personas muy trabajadoras y actualmente colocaron una cancha de voleibol y una mesa de billar lo que genera mayor concurrencia de personas y mayor venta, y gracias al apoyo de la fundación paraguaya han logrado crecer bastante.
Pedro solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados y demás insumos para poder abastecer su despensa y seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que Pedro es un cliente recurrente de la fundación.
texts.en:
Pedro is a merchant and he and his wife Maria run a small store in their own home. Pedro and his wife are very hardworking and now they have put a volleyball court and a pool table in to bring in more people and sales. Thanks to the support from the Fundación Paraguaya, they have been able to grow a lot.

Pedro is asking for the loan to buy beverages, food products, dairy products, baked goods and othe rotems to stock their store and keep offering a good selection to their customers. He is thankful for the ooportunity he is getting, since Pedro is a recurring customer of the foundation.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food products, dairy products, baked goods and other items.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 69 years old and married with six children.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a coconut retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional coconuts to sell.

Milagros has borrowed and paid back eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the coconut retail business for 20 years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Milagros aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional coconuts to sell

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
For over five years in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur in the Philippines, Pacita, a 43-year-old married mother of 3 children, has made a living through operating a general store selling a variety of food and home-use products. She earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Pacita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo and soaps. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, and soaps.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. She is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Teresa is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Teresa has been farming rice for 14 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Pinky

texts.en:
Pinky is 38 years old and married with one child.

Pinky works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Pinky has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Pinky aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky is 31 years old and married with one child.

Vicky works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Vicky has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal retail business for a year and earns additional income from raising pigs.

Vicky aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Jessica requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business. She has been in this business for 9 years now, and also earns additional income from clothing sales.

In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is married with 8 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Salvacion is 45 years old and 5 of her children are in school.

Salvacion has a fishing boat business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy gasoline and maintain her fishing boat.

Salvacion has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Salvacion would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and maintain her fishing boat.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es: Doris de 55 años vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla y se dedica ala venta de calzado, ella desde Aruba recibe este producto y lo distribuye entre sus clientes que le pagan a crédito, mientras ella responde por las compras de contado. Este negocio lo inició desde hace 5 años con un capital de trabajo de $200.000 COP, que le regalaron en la familia, para que se ayudara en los gastos de su hogar, ya que su condición de viuda, quedó con una hija menor de edad quien hoy tiene 17 años y es ella el motor de toda su energía, para que algún día tenga posibilidades de ser exitosa, pudiendo estudiar. Su meta es convertir su negocio en un almacén, bien organizado, en su propia casa donde su clientela,  pueda ver exhibida mercancía  variada y no tener ir a comprarla cuando le solicitan un producto. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprara calzado en mayor volumen, en el marco de pedidos de sus más rentables clientes, quienes son las que multiplican una buena información de su negocio y del servicio especial que Doris presta.   Su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo es insuficiente, para responder a los pedidos de sus clientes, porque su cartera de cuentas por cobrar es más lenta que el crecimiento de su clientela nueva.
texts.en: Doris is 55 years old. She lives in Barranquila and sells shoes. The shoes are made in Aruba. She sells them to her customers on layaway. She buys the shoes after she gets the orders. She started this business five years ago with $200,000 COP of working capital that was provided to her by her family. The business helps her with her household expenses. She is a widow. She has a minor child that is 17 years old. She focuses all of her energy on her work so that her child can have an education and be successful. She would like to change her business into a well-organized store in her home where her customers can shop for a variety of merchandise. They wouldn’t have to wait to receive the merchandise they request. She is applying to KIVA for the first time through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use the loan to buy shoes wholesale, in the brands that her customers request the most. These loyal customers are the ones who appreciate the information and good service that Doris provides. Her biggest challenge is that she has insufficient working capital so she can’t respond to her customer requests. The money she has from previous customers does not cover the increasing demand of the new customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila is 48 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Cerila is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her piglets.

Cerila has been raising pigs for four years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her piglets

loans.name: Herminita

texts.en:
Herminita is 48 years old and single with three children.

She earns a living by farming pineapple in the Philippines. Herminita is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Herminita has been farming pineapple for nine years and earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Teodosa

texts.en:
Teodosa is 63 years old and widowed with three children.

Teodosa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional products to sell.

Teodosa has borrowed and paid back 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from fishing.

Teodosa aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additonal products to sell

loans.name: Patricia Del Carmen

texts.es: En un local externo en la puerta de un hotel, Patricia mujer de 39 años, ofrece el servicio de venta de minutos a celulares, refrescos, dulcería y productos de aseo  en general, con el fin de genera ingresos que apoyen el bienestar de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 11 a 23 años.  Su negocio fue idea de su esposo, a quien le diagnosticaron un problema de salud y no pudo seguir trabajando en las actividades del hotel, cuyos clientes principales son los conductores de camión, que diariamente circulan por la ciudad y transportan cargas; por todo esto,  hace 4 años con un dinero ahorrado, invirtieron en dulces inicialmente y  poco a poco han ido agregando otros productos, como hasta hoy lo hacen. En la actualidad el potencial de sus clientes es muy amplio y muy pronto terminan con la oferta de los productos que vende Patricia y su capital de trabajo no alcanza a surtir y a tener inventarios suficientes, sin tener que ir nuevamente de compras; esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude  a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprara refrescos en mayor volumen, dulces y pasabocas, productos con los cuales mantendrá un buen surtido de inventarios y a sus clientes viajeros muy felices, por tener lo que ellos quieren encontrar cada vez que llegan al local comercial de Patricia y su esposo y es esto lo que hace que la inversión de credikiva sea muy efectiva y tenga éxito.
texts.en: Standing in front of the door of a local hotel, Patricia, age 39, sells minutes on a cellular phone, drinks, sweets and general grocery products. She does this with the goal of helping her household meet the needs of her husband and three children, eleven to twenty-three years old. This business was her husband’s idea. He has a health problem and can’t continue with his work in the hotel. The principle customers of the hotel are truck drivers, who drive around the city each day delivering their cargo. For the past four years, with money that they had saved, they bought sweets to sell. Little by little they started buying other products, until they had all the products they sell today. Their business has a lot of potential. They sell their products very quickly. The working capital that Patricia has does not allow her to buy a variety of products nor have a large inventory. She needs to buy new items before the current items are sold. This is why she is requesting a loan from KIVA and the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She will use this loan to buy sodas, sweets and snacks at a wholesale level. These are items that she needs in order to have a good inventory for her customers so that they are happy when they travel. If, when they patronize the business of Patricia and her husband, they find what they desire, Paticia and her husband will be successful

loans.use: to buy large quantities of soda, sweets, snacks and a variety of other products.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 61 years old and married with 5 children. She works very hard to provide for her family. Delia runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, shampoo, canned goods, spices, etc. She would like to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: purchase additional stocks to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Sol

texts.es:
Desde hace 12 años, Sol una mujer de 46 años, se dedicó a la venta de productos cosméticos y perfumería, mediante guías especializadas; aunque al principio, su relación de vinculación con varias revistas, no fue duradera, adquirió mucha experiencia comercial y solo cuando una amiga le presentó una mejor propuesta de trabajo de ventas de productos cosméticos y accesorios, empezó a trabajar con  ella, ganando un porcentaje de lo que vendía, pero sin vincularse directamente a la revista. Cuando Sol ganó un buen mercado y se sintió segura de su estabilidad en esta tarea comercial,  se vinculó directamente a esa empresa, con la cual le fue bien y expandió su clientela.  En la actualidad tiene 3 familiares, que   apoyan su gestión comercial, ganando también dinero y esto a ella le ha gustado mucho, pues permanentemente la mantiene activa. Sus principales clientes son mujeres, amas de casa, empleados, a quienes les venden los productos a crédito, que finalmente lo pagan en un plazo de un mes. Sol es apasionada por su trabajo y cada día tiene sus propias metas y las cumple frecuentemente, como las de ganar 3 clientes diarios y no se limita a su propio barrio sino también busca alternativas en otros barrios aunque se encuentren a 15, 20 o 40 minutos de distancia. En su vinculación con la revista ha ganado muchos premios, tiene importantes volúmenes de ventas y esto la estimula a continuar y apoyar a su esposo, de actividad albañil independiente y a sus tres hijos en las edades de 9 a 19 años. En su negocio es muy comprometida tiene sus cuentas bien organizadas y su recuperación de cartera la hace semanalmente. 
Su mayor desafío es ampliar el plazo de crédito a sus clientes, pero los pagos a sus proveedores así lo exigen; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,comprar cosméticos en descuentos y para financiar la cartera de los clientes y ofreciendole mejores y mas amplios plazos de pago y acceder a las oportunidades de descuentos, que a ellos trasladará, lo cual amplia su mercado en consecuencia y permitirá que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
For 12 years Sol, a 46-year-old woman, has sold cosmetic products and perfume through catalogs. Although at the beginning her connections to various companies were not long lasting, she gained a lot of retail experience. Only when a friend presented her with a better sales job offer for cosmetic products and accessories did she begin to work with her, earning a percentage of what she sold, but without connecting herself directly with the company. When Sol had acquired a good client base and she felt sure of the stability in this commercial sector, she connected directly with this catalog company. This has gone well for her and she has expanded her client base. 

Currently Sol has three family members who support her business and are also earning money, which she likes a lot, so she keeps it active permanently. 

Most of her customers are women, house wives, and employees. She sells products to them on credit, and in the end they pay in installments of a month. 

Sol is passionate for her job, and every day she has her own goals, which she frequently makes - such as gaining three customers a day - and she doesn't limit herself to her own neighborhood. She also looks for opportunities in other neighborhoods, even though they're 15, 20 or 40 minutes away. Through her connection with this company, she has won many prizes. She has impressive sales volume, and she expects this to continue. She supports her husband, an independent builder, and their three children who are between the ages of 9 and 19 years old. 

In her business she is very committed; she has all of her accounts well organized and she collects payments weekly. 

Sol's greatest challenge is improving the terms of credit to her customers, but her suppliers demand the payments. This is why she is turning to a Kiva loan - her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo - to buy cosmetics at a discount, and to offer better and more varied financing options to her customers. She will also pass along discount opportunities, which will grow her business as a result, and make possible a successful investment of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at a discount.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is 42 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell.

Fatima has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Fatima aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy more stocks to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 25 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marjorie is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for the last one year, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Marjorie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a business of buying and selling rice in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs and buying and selling charcoal. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

She has been sustaining her business activities through the past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that with her hard work she will be able to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 31 years old and married with 2 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF previously. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from E-loading.

Ma. Luz aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is is 40 years old and married with three children. She resides at Camarin, Tudela, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Corazon owns & operates a business venture selling seafood products such as crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years. 

She earns PHP 4,000 per month from this business activity. Corazon is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase sea food items such as crabs, shrimp, fish and oyster. Corazon has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to build a house and help her children compete their education.

loans.use: to purchase sea foods such as crabs, shrimp, fish and oyster

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an Avon products retail business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of Avon products to sell to her customers.

Delia has been in this business for 10 years and earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Delia dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products to sell.

loans.name: Jhon

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jhon;el socio continua trabajando en su negocio de venta de artesanía ,el trabaja conjuntamente con su esposa ,el socio trabaja desde las 9:00 am hasta las 10:00 p.m aproximadamente,el vende su mercaderia por el centro de la ciudad ,siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia,el socio es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando.

El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como polos y ponchos.

 
El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Jhon is a member of the Communal Bank "Kukuli" which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

He continues to work in his business of selling handicrafts. Jhon and his wife work together. His work schedule is from 9am to approximately 10pm. He sells his merchandise in the center of the city, which enables him to help his family move forward. Jhon is a cheerful and responsible person who has the drive to continue working. He is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise, such as polo shirts and ponchos.

Jhon is grateful to everyone who helped him fulfill his dream in this manner and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts and ponchos.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel es un hombre casado que tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 3 y 8 años. Después de trabajar 5 años en una empresa, decidió vender mercancía  variada, al ver que su esposa tenia una tienda   en su casa y  generaba ingresos. pero con mucho trabajo.  Poco a poco fue construyendo su clientela y así mismo haciendo más rentable su negocio, por lo cual decidió con su esposa, convertir la tienda en miscelánea, pues generaba menos trabajo y más utilidades. En la actualidad sus principales productos son la ropa, los cosméticos, las fantasías y sobre todo ajuares para bebe. Su negocio hoy tiene dos años de estar funcionando y espera convertirlo en un gran almacén, reconocido por todos en el municipio. En la actualidad Daniel fue referido por otra prestataria vinculada a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a un credikiva, su primer financiamiento, con el cual comprará maquillaje, accesorios femenino, ropa en la línea de bebe, que son los productos de mayor rotación y requiere tener mayor inventario de ellos. Su credikiva se potencializa como exitoso, porque  comprará en mayor volumen, ganando descuentos y está ajustado a la demanda del mercado. Con ello Daniel aumentará su capital de trabajo y paso a paso, podrá cumplir con su sueño de crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with two children, ages 3 and 8. After working for a business for five years, he decided to sell assorted merchandise after seeing his wife have a store in their home and generate income. 

But it was a lot of work. Little by little he built up his client base, and at the same time made his business more profitable. That's why he decided with his wife to convert the store into a variety store, so there would be less work and more profits. Currently his main products are clothing, cosmetics, novelty items and above all, layettes for babies. 

Today his business has been running for two years, and he hopes to convert it into a big shop, known by everyone in town. 

Daniel was actually referred by another another borrower connected to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to gain access to Kiva loans. His first financing, he will buy makeup, women's accessories, and baby clothing, which are the most popular products and require a bigger inventory than others. His Kiva loan will boost itself successfully, because he will buy large quantities, earning discounts, and he is used to market demand. With this Daniel will increase his working capital, and step by step, he will be able to reach his dream of entrepreneurial growth.

loans.use: to buy makeup, women's accessories, and clothing for babies.

loans.name: Alenys Meleth

texts.es: Alenys   con su credikiva,  compró todo lo necesario para aumentar la venta de productos  en su negocio de comidas rápidas y eso fue justamente lo que logró gracias a su credikiva. En la actualidad requiere comprar licuadora, ollas, pailas, y una estufa, activos con las cuales estará mas cómoda trabajando y el resultado será efectividad para su clientela. También invertirá en materias primas e insumos en mayor volumen, para continuar ganando descuentos por compras en volumen y de contado y esto es justamente lo que hace exitoso el credikiva. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Deseándole muchas bendiciones y que sigan apoyando al microempresario para cumplir el sueño de hacer realidad sus metas. “
texts.en: With her Kiva loan, Alenys bought everything she needed to increase sales in her fast food business, and thanks to the loan, this was exactly what she managed to do.  Now she wants to buy a blender, pots, pans and a stove, which will make her work more comfortable and will make her more efficient in serving her customers.  In addition, she will buy some raw materials and supplies in large quantities, so that she can continue to take advantage of discounts for buying in bulk and for cash purchases.  This is exactly what makes the Kiva loans successful.  Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following, "I wish you many blessings, and hope that you will continue supporting small business-people so that they can fulfill their dreams of accomplishing their goals."

loans.use: To buy a blender, pots, pans and a stove, and also to invest in raw materials and bulk purchases of supplies

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Evangeline works hard to support her family.

She has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and food vending business. Evangeline is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 59 years old, married and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business farming vegetables in the Philippines. Elsie is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elsie has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough to buy more farm lands.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Mujeres Luchadoras”  ya que todas están luchando para su progreso no solo de ellas sino también de sus familias.
La Directora, la Sra. Mercedes, es vendedora de ropas de todo tipo y variedad, es una persona muy humilde, responsable, activa y con muchas ganas de salir adelante e ir creciendo como persona y como comerciante. Su sueño es poder tener un gran comercio y así ser una comerciante importante
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de toda variedad, con lo cual podrá tener mayor variedad que poder ofrecer a sus clientes y así tener un poco mas de ingresos.
texts.en:
The committee known as "Mujeres Luchadoras" (Striving Women) is aptly named since all of its members are striving to make progress, not only for themselves, but also for their families.

The director, Sra. Mercedes, is a vendor who offers all types and varieties of clothing. She is a humble, responsible, and active individual who has plenty of drive to succeed and to grow as a person and as a businesswoman. Her dream is to have a large shop and to become a major retailer. She is requesting a loan in order to buy clothing of all varieties. By having more variety to offer to her customers, Mercedes will be able to earn a little more income.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Tin's Group

texts.en:
Tin and his family live in a cottage made from bamboo wall located in Dambae district. He and his wife have been farming rice for over 20 years and growing cassava for 7 years to support their family. They have seven children, of which six still live with the family and attend school. 

His family earns on average less than 5 US dollars per day. Tin and another group member have decided to apply for loans from VisionFund for the first time amounting to 1 million khmer riel each. 

As the group leader, Tin wants to use his portion to prepare land for his cassava plantation and rice field. He hopes this loan will help him make more money and that way he can feed his family better and his children can continue to be in school.

loans.use: to spend on land preparation for his plantation

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old, married and has four children. To make a living, Aida owns and operates a cafeteria business, cooking goods and selling them to the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 22 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from these activities. 

Aida is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital to purchase raw materials for her cafeteria. In 2010, Aida joined GDMPC to seek financial assistance as an additional investment for her business. She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and support her children's education.

loans.use: to use as additional capital and purchase raw materials for the cafeteria.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Saroeurn

texts.en: As a married mother of five, Saroeurn has been growing cassava  for three years to support her family. Selling rice and Chinese noodles soup is her other source of income. She has been selling such food for four years. Saroeurn and her family live in a wooden house located in Kompong Cham province. Saroeurn obtained her first loan from Kiva's field partner, VisionFund in 2010. The past two loans have helped Saroeurn to sufficiently provide for her family's daily life and to afford the children's school fees. Saroeurn is now applying for another loan from VisionFund after successfully repaying all her previous obligations. She is planning to use this loan to buy seedlings and fertilizers for her cassava plantation. She wishes that this loan will enable her to grow good-yield crops so that she can sell them for a higher price and in return her family can live in better conditions and set aside money for her kids's school fees until they graduate and find good jobs.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is a married woman who has two children. She is 41 years old, and resides at Calabayan, Ozamis City, Philippines. Loreta owns a pig breeding business, growing pigs for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase feeds and vaccine for the pigs. In 2012, Loreta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements on her house and the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vaccine for her pigs

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “KUKULI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra. Maria Luisa ;La socia continua con el negocio de venta de artesanías como chompas, aretes, collares y bolsos, la socia trabaja todos los dias desde las 10:00am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente,ella vende su mercaderia en un stand por el centro de la ciudad,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de salir adelante por su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio como chompas. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria Luisa is a member of the Communal Bank "Kukuli" which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She continues with her business of selling handicrafts such as sweaters, earrings, necklaces, and bags. Maria Luisa works every day from 10am to approximately 10pm. She sells her merchandise from a stand in the center of the city. Maria Luisa is a cheerful and responsible person who has the drive to succeed on behalf of her family. She is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her business, such as sweaters.

Maria Luisa is grateful to everyone who helped to fulfill her dream in this manner and promises to complete her loan payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business, including sweaters.

loans.name: Joven

texts.en:
Joven is married with 2 children. He is 30 years old and lives in Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.

Joven operates a general store, selling a variety of products to the local community members to earn a living. He has been doing this business for five years and earns PHP 5,000 each month from this work. He has requested a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

In 2011, Joven joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He hopes to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Saroun's Group

texts.en: Saroun, aged 50, is a married mother of five of whom three boys are dependent on the family. Living in Dambae district where a common business is planting cassava, Saroun and her family have been planting such crop and farming rice for almost twenty years to support their family. She struggles when she has insufficient rice to eat and scarce capital for her cassava business. Her family makes around six US dollar per day. Saroun has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and is now leading a group of three female members to request another loan from VisionFund after completely paying off their previous debt. As a leader, Saroun will use her portion to pay for land plowing and labor fees for her plantation. She hopes this loan will help her make more income and hence improve her family's living condition and help her children have good jobs.

loans.use: To pay for land plowing and labor fees

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
“Santa Librada”  se encuentra en el 3 Ciclo con 12 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades productivas, son muy unidas responsables y solidarias entre ellas y también tratan de poder ayudar a su comunidad.
Maria es una de estas mujeres, ella es muy trabajadora y luchadora y nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de sabanas de todo tipo y clases. Comenta que tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella, ya que sus productos son muy buenos y no son muy costosos. Ella solicita el crédito para poder surtirse con diferentes clases de sabanas, para poder tener más variedad y también para poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
"Santa Librada" is a group that is in its third loan cycle with 12 members. All of them engage in their respective business activities and are unified, responsible, and supportive of one another. They also try to help their community.

Maria is one of these women. She is a hardworking and determined woman who says that she sells different types and styles of bed sheets. Maria says that she has good customers who always buy from her because her products are very good and do not cost a lot. She is requesting a loan so that she can restock with different types of bed sheets. This will enable her to have more variety and also help her to fulfill her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy bed sheets to sell.

loans.name: Tsend-Ochir

texts.en: Mr. Tsend-Ochir, 37 sells the skins of livestock to customers. This business is kind of popular on the Mongolian market. He has been running his business for 5 years and buys his skins from the big outdoor market and sells them to the craftsmen in rural areas. Because most craftsmen in rural areas have difficulties to prepare their craft raw materials, they are expensive. He lives with his family in a common apartment in Kherlen, an eastern boundary town. His wife works as a vender in the grocery store and his son attends a secondary school. This time, Tsend-Ochir is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of skins to prepare his inventory due to the large sales volume in the summertime. He believes that he will become one of the largest skin suppliers to the craftsmen in Mongolia.

loans.use: To buy skins in a large amount to prepare his inventory due to the large sales volume in the summertime.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en: Felicitas is a widow and a mother of 4 dependents. She is 46 years old and lives in Waterfall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Felicitas established a business buying and selling liquor and soft drinks as a way of generating extra income of 3,600 per month. She has been engaged in this type of business for 3 years. Felicitas requested a loan of 6,000 from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to buy more liquor items to sell. Felicitas has been a good member of GDMPC for 3 years. In the future, Felicitas wants to expand her business site.

loans.use: to buy more liquor items to sell

location.town: Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Johana Maria

texts.es:
Johana tiene 28 años de edad, es casada, tiene 1 hijo y vive en una aldea rural del  Municipio de Macuelizo Santa Barbará.
Johana tiene un negocio de pulpería que estableció desde hace 1 año. Pudo establecerlo  con el  afán de  mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Ella vende en su negocio productos de primera necesidad como granos básicos, harina, arroz, manteca, frijoles, huevos, embutidos, pollo,  pan, condimentos y otros productos enlatados. Manifiesta que esta cómoda porque además de atender su propio negocio,  no se desentiende de su familia dedicándole el tiempo necesario.
Esta solicitando el primer préstamo con ODEF de 21000 lempiras para poder abastecerse de productos para la venta y ofrecer variedad de productos a su clientela, como (Frijoles, arroz, harina, azúcar, maseca, manteca, carnes, embutidos, pollo etc.) 
Sus meta es seguir trabajando en el negocio, para lograr solventar económicamente gastos del hogar como la Educación de su hijo cuando el tenga la edad para estudiar. También desea tener otro negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Johana is 28 years old, married, and has one child. She lives in a rural neighborhood in the town of Macuelizo Santa Barbará.

Johana has a grocery business that she established a year ago. Her intention for starting this business was to improve her family's quality of life and to help her husband with the household expenses. In her business, Johana sells basic necessity products such as grains, flour, rice, butter, beans, eggs, sausages, chicken, bread, condiments, and other canned products. She says that she feels comfortable because she can attend to her business without having to sacrifice the time she needs to devote to her family.

Johana is requesting her first loan from ODEF in the amount of 21,000 HNL so that she can restock with products to sell such as beans, rice, flour, sugar, cornmeal, lard, meats, sausages, chicken, and other items. She will be able to offer variety to her customers. Her goals are to continue working in her business, cover the household expenses (include education for her school-age child), and open another business selling food.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: San Jose Group

texts.es:
El grupo San José es de la ciudad de Pilar, es un grupo que está empezando a trabajar, ya que están en el primer ciclo. Ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con gran deseos de superación para poder ayudar a sus familias.
La Sra. Ermelinda se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, nos comenta que mediante este negocio la economía de la familia mejoró bastante ya que ella es ciega y con su venta logró mejorar la economía de su casa y también hacer estudiar a su hijo.
La Sra. Ermelinda Solicita el crédito para la compra de productos de limpieza para la venta y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia y seguir sintiéndose útil.
texts.en:
The group "San José" is from the city of Pilar. It is a group that is starting to work together since it is only in its first loan cycle. The members are hardworking women who have the desire to succeed in order to help their families.

Sra. Ermelinda sells cleaning products and says that her business has improved her family's finances. Ermelinda is blind, but she is able to sell and help improve the financial situation at home. She is also able to provide an education for her son. Sra. Ermelinda is requesting a loan to buy cleaning products to sell. This will allow her to continue helping her family and to continue feeling useful.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to sell.

loans.name: Emilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia Emilia pertenece al banco comunal KUKULI ,La socia continua con su negocio de artesanía ,la socia tiene un stand por el centro de la ciudad donde vende su mercaderia como chompas,polos,trabajos en ceramica entre otros,la socia trabaja todos los dias desde las 09:00 am hasta las 10:00pm aproximadamente,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mercaderia para su negocio como polos. 

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Emilia is a member of the Communal Bank "Kukuli". She continues with her handicraft business and manages a stand in the central part of the city where she sells her merchandise such as sweaters, polo shirts, ceramic crafts, and other items. Emilia works every day from 9am to approximately 10pm. She is a responsible and industrious person. Emilia feels that working in this manner has allowed her family to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her business, such as polo shirts. Emilia is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, including polo shirts.

loans.name: Janine

texts.en:
Janine is married and has two children. She is 26 years old and resides at Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Janine owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting vegetables to sell to earn a living, and she's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP from this type of business. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2012, Janine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Janine wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa, 44, is cook and she runs a small eating house in the downtown of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Since 2006 she has been running her business; before this she used to work as a chief cook in another restaurant. 

She lives with her husband and her daughter on her plot of land in the ger district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. She has three old houses on her plot of land and she rents two of them. But lately her houses have been in very bad condition and need repairs. So she wants to take a loan to buy the building materials for the repairs of her old houses. 

She is planning to insulate the walls of her own living house first. Because it becomes very cold inside the house without wall insulation, it costs too much money for the smoky coal needed to warm the inside of the house. 

Also lack of insulation has a bad effect on the air of the city. Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters, when temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F), even in the cities. Also, in summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snowstorms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. 

In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss and improve heating systems. We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan Ariunaa is taking will be dedicated to buying building materials to make repairs and to insulate the walls of her house to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.use: to buy building materials to make repairs and to insulate the walls of her house to reduce heat loss and emissions.

loans.name: Khuvaido

texts.ru: Хувайдо – 29 лет, женат, имеет 3 сыновей. Он очень ответственный, трудолюбивый и пунктуальный мужчина. Занимается торговлей парфюмерной продукции. Опыт в этой деятельности более 5 лет. Хувайдо старший сын и живет вместе с родителями. Его жена не работает, она занимается хозяйством, и воспитанием сыновей. У них имеется небольшой сад. Отец Хувайдо очень хороший садовник, он присматривает за садом, ухаживает за деревьями и получает хороший урожай. Ещё у них есть домашние животные (коровы, козы, овцы) за которыми тоже ухаживает отец. Хувайдо помогает своим родителям зарабатывая самостоятельно. Ведь родители должны дать образование и обустроить остальных детей. Так как начинается свадебный сезон, на полученный кредит Хувайдо хочет увеличить ассортимент  товаров. Хувайдо и его родители выражают свою благодарность нашей организации за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Khuvaido is 29 years old, married, and has three sons.  He is a very responsible, hardworking and punctual man. He sells perfume products, and has more than 5 years of experience in this field. 

Khuvaido is the oldest son in his family and he lives with his parents. His wife is not employed; she takes care of the household and raises their sons.  

The family has a small garden. Khuvaido's father, an experienced gardener, is the one taking care of the garden, caring for the trees and growing nice farm products.  The family also owns livestock (cows, goats, sheep), and Khuvaido's father also takes care of the animals.  

Thanks to Khuvaido's help, his parents are financially independent, and can educate their grandchildren and prepare them for the future.

As it is the beginning of the wedding season, Khuvaido would like to use his loan to increase his assortment of products.  

Khuvaido and his parents are grateful for the financial support provided by our organization.

loans.use: to expand his business and increase his assortment of perfume products.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en: Flordeliza is from Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 35 years old. Flordeliza is married and has three children. To make a living, Flordeliza is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home use products in the local community. Flordeliza has been in her business for five years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. Flordeliza is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2011, Flordeliza joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Selveria

texts.en: Selveria is a widow with three children. Selveria is 65 years old and lives in Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. To earn a living, she sells personal products such as lotions, bras, and more. She has been operating this business for five years and earns 6,000 PHP each month. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP from GDMPC to obtain more personal products to sell. Selveria has been a member of the cooperative since 2008. In the future, Selveria hopes to be more progressive in this venture and would like to be able to expand the facility and product offerings to attract more customers.

loans.use: to obtain more personal products to sell.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en: Margarita is a 55-year-old married woman with two children living in Balintawak, Aurora, Zambo. Del Sur. In order to make additional income for the family, she entered into a business planting & harvesting flowers for sale seven years ago. Margarita usually earns 5,500 PHP a month. Margarita joined GDMPC in 2011 and she borrowed 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She was able to improve her business because of the money rendered to her. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en: As a parent of nine, Hen and her husband have been growing cassava for 10 years and farming rice for 25 years to make a living. The main obstacle for her is when the price of cassava drops. Hen has been with VisionFund for four loan cycles and these previous loans have helped to increase her crop yield. Hen is now leading a group of two female members to apply for another loan from VisionFund. As a leader, she plans to use this loan to spend on land plowing for her field and strongly hopes it will help to further increase her crop yield so that she can sell the products for higher prices to better feed her family.

loans.use: To pay for having her land plowed

loans.name: Oun's Group

texts.en: Oun is 37 years old and a married mother of two: one boy and one girl. Her two kids are still in school. To earn a living, Oun and her husband have been farming rice and selling coconuts for almost 20 years. Oun also owns a small grocery store to generate additional income. Per day, she makes about five US dollars. Oun received her first loan from VisionFund in 2011 and this loan has helped to support her family's daily expenses including food and the children's school fees. After successfully paying the first loan, Oun is now leading a group of four female members to request another loan. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and spend on land plowing. She hopes the second loan will enable her to make more income from her rice farming business so she can feed her family sufficiently and keep her two children in school until they are finished.

loans.use: To pay for plowing and fertilzers

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas district

loans.name: Mey's Group

texts.en: Mey is 50 years and has six children, three of whom are still studying. Mey and her family live in a rural area located in Dambae district. To make a living, Mey and her family have been planting cassava for over 10 years.  Her business struggles when the price of cassava in the market drops. Mey obtained her first loan from VisionFund in 2010. Now she is leading a group of two female members to apply for another loan since her first loan has been paid. As the leader, Mey requested the loan and plans to use her portion to buy fertilizers and spend the remaining money on land plowing and labor fees. She hopes this loan will help to expand her business.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, labor fees and fertilizers

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son’s local food restaurant business. He runs a small restaurant where he serves his customers local food items like “Daal chawal" (made with rice and lentils) and "Nan chanay" (made with chickpeas and served with bread). 
 
With the loan investment, he will buy ingredients such as cooking oil, spices, lentils, and chickpeas in larger quantities to make better quality food and offer improved services to his clients He will also put some furniture in his restaurant to facilitate his clients.
 
Kalsoom is also a working lady and operates an animal sales business with her husband. Her husband purchases young animals, raises them and then sells them to butchers for a profit. Kalsoom provides full support to her husband in his business.
 
She is confident that her son will be able to improve his products and services and earn more profits from his business with the help of a loan investment.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for the restaurant business

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en: Jeremias is from La Victoria Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is married and has three children. He is 32 years old. Jeremias used his last loan to purchase additional used shoes ("okay-okay") to sell. His business is successful, and he is taking a new loan to buy more shoes ("okay-okay") to sell.. In the future, he hopes to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more used shoes ("okay-okay") to sell.

loans.name: Barnaba

texts.en:
Barnaba is 42 years and married to Mary who helps him maintain the family. They have three children who are 22, 16 and 15 years old, respectively. He has been running his livestock feed business for six years earning KSH 22,500 monthly.   

He is servicing his fourth loan of KES 35,000 from KADET LTD, after successfully repaying back his previous loans. He is going to use the loan to purchase livestock feed for resale. He plans to uset the anticipated profits from the business to build rental houses. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a well equipped livestock feed store.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed for resale.

loans.name: Geneveve

texts.en: Geneveve is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Geneveve owns and operates a farm, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns PHP 7,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase farm chemicals. Geneveve has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Geneveve plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Carmen Dinalda

texts.es:
Con 5300 pesos Carmen desea comprar inventario para alcanzar un mayor número de clientes y poder aumentar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su hija a pagar la universidad.
Carmen vende desde hace siete años accesorios  y ropa interior de manera ambulante a todos sus conocidos y vecinos de la comunicad y otros pueblos cercanos. Este es el único ingreso que hay en su casa, además de dos mil pesos que le aportan sus hijos todos los meses.
Carmen es viuda y madre de seis hijos. El mayor tiene 30 y la menor tiene 20 años. Ya todos se han casado, excepto por la menor que estudia y vive en la casa con ella.
Barranca Abajo es una comunidad muy pobre localizada en el precioso y fértil valle de La  Vega. Aunque es uno de los valles agrícolas más productivos de la República Dominicana, el nivel de pobreza en las comunidades que le rodean es muy alto. 
Carmen desea expandir su negocio y ofrecer una mayor variedad de mercancía a sus clientes y en el futuro tener un local donde sus clientes puedan venir  a comprar.
texts.en:
With 5,300 pesos, Carmen wants to purchase inventory to gain a larger number of customers and be able to increase her income so that she can help her daughter pay for university. 

Carmen has sold accessories and under clothes door to door for seven years. She makes her sales with her acquaintances and neighbors in her community and other nearby towns. This is the only source of income in her home aside from the 2,000 pesos that her children support her with each month. Carmen is a widow and the mother of six children. The eldest is 30 years old and the youngest is 20 years old. All of them have married except for the youngest who is studying and lives with her in her home. 

Barranca Abajo is a very poor community located in the beautiful and fertile valley of La Vega. Although it is one of the most productive agricultural valleys in the Dominican Republic, the level of poverty in the surrounding communities is very high.

Carmen wants to expand her business and offer a greater variety of merchandise to her customers. In the future she wants to have a shop where her customers can come to make their purchases.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to supply her business.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio forma parte del Banco Comunal “Todos Juntos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
El se dedica al rubro de ventas de frutas y verduras en  las ferias libres, trabaja con su esposa los días jueves y domingo, se desempeña en sus labores desde hace 8 años.
Su mercadería la compra en un abastecimiento que se especializa en vender productos de frutas y verduras.
Con el crédito comprará mercadería y arreglará su vehículo para transportar su mercadería.
Una de las metas de Julio son poder crecer en su negocio para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Julio vive junto a su esposa. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y  tener un local propio.
Julio está muy contento y agradecido del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómodo con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Julio is a member of the communal bank "Todos Juntos", which belongs to the city of Viña del Mar.  He and his wife sell fruits and vegetables at free markets, and have been in business for eight years.

He buys his goods from a supplier who specializes in fruits and vegetables.  With the loan he will buy merchandise and repair the vehicle he uses to transport the goods.

One of Julio's goals is to expand business to earn more income so he can lead a better lifestyle.  He lives with his wife and their dream is to continue working and open their own establishment.

Julio is very happy and grateful for the loan and services he has received through Fondo Esperanza.  He says he feels very comfortable in the communal bank meetings and with the members of the group, because there is generosity and unity.

Viña del Mar is a city on the coast of central Chile.  It is also known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios that many old residences in the city have.  It is also considered Chile's tourist capital.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana forma parte del Banco Comunal “Todos Juntos” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar.
Ella se dedica al rubro de comerciante, específicamente a la venta de verduras.
Juana se desempeña en sus labores de comerciante todos los días y su horario de trabajo lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Con el crédito cambiara su vehículo.
Su mercadería la compra en abastecimientos de verduras para su negocio. Una de sus metas son comprar un camión para trasladarse con su mercadería a su puesto de trabajo.
Juana vive junto a su hija quien se encuentra estudiando. Sus sueños son hacer un segundo piso en su casa, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con la compañía de las demás emprendedoras del grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que comparten diferentes actividades, intereses, lo cual también le ha servido como un momento de distracción.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank "Todos Juntos", which belongs to the city of Viña del Mar.

She is a merchant and sells vegetables.  Juana works every day and establishes her work schedule depending on her availability.  With the loan she plans to change her vehicle.  She buys goods from vegetable wholesalers, and one of her goals is to buy a truck to transport the goods to her workplace.

Juana lives with her daughter who is in school.  She wants to add a second storey to their house to give her daughter a better lifestyle.

She is happy and grateful for the opportunity given her by Fondo Esperanza, since it has allowed her to invest in her business.  She feels very comfortable with the other entrepreneurs in the communal bank group, because they all share their business experiences and interests.  So it has become like a hobby for her.

Viña del Mar is a city on the central coast of Chile, also known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios the old city residences have.  It is also known as the tourist capital of Chile.

loans.use: To change her vehicle.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.en:
Priscila is 43 years-old and supports a family of five people. She is married to Tito who helps to provide for the family. They are blessed with five children aged between three to 21 years. Priscila is running a cereals business of buying and selling maize; she has been in operation for seven years now and has a monthly income of KES 8,000.  

She has good history with KADET LTD, this is her sixth loan of KES 85,000, after successfully servicing her previous loans. She will be using the loan to buy dry maize stock for resale.

With the anticipated profits from the cereals business, she plans to add more stock of dry maize for resale. Her hopes and dreams are to be able to provide her children with quality education.

loans.use: to buy dry maize stock for resale.

loans.name: Killa Group

texts.es:
Un grupo de vecinos y amigos formaron el banco comunal “Killa” en la ciudad de Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. Las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo; venta de ropa, algunos trabajan como profesores y otros brindan servicio de llamadas.   
 
(La señora Olga está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Olga nació en la ciudad del Cusco, tiene 25 años de edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Olga es la venta de comida, ella tiene un pequeño restaurante pero el local es alquilado y cada mes paga un alquiler. Ya es un año que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. Olga en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para implementar el restaurante ósea desea comprar sillas, mesas, platos y otros más. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística por sus centros arqueológicos por su centro histórico por sus paisajes por su historia y siendo una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
A group of neighbors and friends formed the communal bank "Killa" in the city of Cusco.  This communal bank is comprised of people always looking for opportunities to get ahead and, through daily effort, provide a better future for their children.  The business activities the members are involved in include clothing sales, teaching, and phone calling services, among others.

(Mrs. Olga is the one raising her hand in the photo).  Olga was born in the city of Cusco.  She is 25 years old, has a common-law husband and three children.  Her main business activity is selling food.  She has a small restaurant in a space that she rents monthly.  For a year now she has been in business and it is going very well thanks to her hard work.  On this occasion, Olga needs a loan to furnish the restaurant with chairs, tables, dishes, etc.

The members, in general, are grateful for this opportunity and committed to paying back their loan installments on time.  Cusco is in the district, province and department of Cusco, in the heart of the old city of the Incas.  It is known for its tourist areas, archeological centers, historic center, landscape, history and because it is one of the most enchanting cities of the southern part of the country.  Cusco is very well-known for being a great tourist and commercial area, for its traditional celebration of Inti Raymi, and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: "Machupicchu".

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs, dishes and other items to furnish her restaurant.

loans.name: Norissa

texts.en: Norissa is 27 years-old. She lives in Calamba, Philippines. Norissa owns and operates a business selling a variety of used clothes (ukay-ukay) to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,200 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Norissa joined GDMPC just this year. Positively, she simply hopes for business improvements.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Irina
